neptis: <entryFree id="n30765" type="main" key="neptis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neptis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (like nepos, orig. <gen>comm.</gen>; as <sense id="n30765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, still found in an inscr.: <cit><quote lang="la">C. COELIO VERO NEPTI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 692, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. nepos as <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> in class. Lat. exclusively) [1. nepos], <hi rend="ital">a granddaughter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filii, filiae, nepotes, neptes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neptes Licinias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:211" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 58, 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis ab uxore et filiā, neptibusque confecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neptis Veneris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ino</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 530</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctas Cybeleia, neptes vidit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Muses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:191" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:265" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 265</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neptim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:2:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neptium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:1:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit> Krüg.—Also, <hi rend="ital">a niece</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 2</bibl>; cf. 1, nepos <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
neptunalis: <entryFree id="n30766" type="main" key="Neptu_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Neptūnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Neptunus</etym>, <sense id="n30766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Neptunian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ludi Neptunales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 6</bibl></cit>.— Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Neptūnālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype> (and ōrum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 460, 3</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">games in honor of Neptune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 19</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 21</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 315</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 663</bibl> ib.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. de Fer. Rom. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 411</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neptunia: <entryFree id="n30767" type="main" key="neptu_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neptūnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neptunicola: <entryFree id="n30768" type="hapax" key="neptu_ni^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neptūnĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Neptunus-colo</etym>, <sense id="n30768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worshipper of Neptune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:443" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 443</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neptunine: <entryFree id="n30769" type="main" key="Neptu_ni_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Neptūnīnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Neptunus</etym>, <sense id="n30769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">granddaughter of Neptune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tene Thetis tenuit pulcherrima Neptunine,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the daughter of Nereus, a son of Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 585</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
neptunius: <entryFree id="n30770" type="main" key="Neptu_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Neptūnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Neptune, Neptunian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">sea-, marine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptunia Troja,</quote> <trans><tr>surrounded with walls by Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:625" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 625</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 691</bibl></cit>: heros, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Theseus</hi>, as the son of Neptune, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Sex. Pompeius, who called himself the adopted son of Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 7</bibl></cit> Schol. Cruq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetneae Neptunius incola rupis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cyclops, the son of Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:56" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuspis,</quote> <trans><tr>the irident</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; so, arva, <cb n="NEQU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 695</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pistrix, i. e. marina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=440" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 440</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neptunus: <entryFree id="n30771" type="main" key="Neptu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Neptūnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Zend, nāpita, wet; Sanscr. nepa, water; Gr. root, <foreign lang="greek">nip-, nib-, ni/fw, xe/rniy</foreign>; cf. nimbus, rain-cloud</etym>, <sense id="n30771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Neptune, the god of the sea and of other waters, brother of Jupiter and husband of Amphitrite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptuno gratis habeo et tempestatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">allocutus summi deum regis fratrem Neptunum, regnatorem Marum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:2:21" default="NO">2, 21</bibl>: omnipotens Neptune, Turp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:34:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 34, 72</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 118 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">Neptunus salsipotens et multipotens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Portumnus a portu, sic Neptunus a nando, paulum primis litteris immutatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 24, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptunum deum numeras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 43</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 20, 52: caeruleos oculos esse Neptuni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uterque,</quote> <trans><tr>who presides over the salt and fresh waters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 31, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptunus pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ad Neptuni pecudes condimenta sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>food for fishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30771.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30771.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sea</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">credere se Neptuno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neptuni corpus acerbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 472</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hibernus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:55" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 55</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n30771.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A fish</hi>, Naev. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58</bibl> Müll. (Com. Rel. v. 121 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
nepus: <entryFree id="n30772" type="gloss" key="ne^pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕpūs</orth> <etym>ne and Sanscr. root pū, cleanse; cf. purus</etym>, <sense id="n30772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unclean, impure</hi>: nepus non purus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=164" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 164</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
nequalia: <entryFree id="n30773" type="gloss" key="ne_qua_lia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquālia</orth>, <itype>detrimenta</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
nequam: <entryFree id="n30774" type="main" key="ne_quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquam</orth>, <sense id="n30774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. indecl</hi>. [for ne-aequam, from aequus], <hi rend="ital">worthless, good for nothing, wretched, vile</hi>, etc. (syn.: inutilis, pravus, vilis). </sense><sense id="n30774.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nequam esse oportet quoi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis nequam est nisi recens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 38</bibl>: enthymema nequam et vitiosum, <hi rend="ital">faulty, defective</hi>, Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl> (7), 3, 27; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=165" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 165</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n30774.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of character, <hi rend="ital">worthless, vile, bad;</hi> opp. frugi (cf. nebulo), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malus et nequam es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequam homo et indiligens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberti nequam et improbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil nequius est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est nequius aut turpius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequior factus, jamst usus aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nequissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 192</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 3</bibl>.—So of <hi rend="ital">licentious, dissolute</hi> persons: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenes nequam facilesque puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:69:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 69, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequior omnibus libellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:15:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 15, 4</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nē-quam</orth>, <hi rend="ital">an injury, mischief, harm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vin' tu illi nequam dare?</quote> <trans><tr>an injury, a mischief</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos nequam abs te habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">worthlessly, wretchedly, badly, miserably</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nequiter fricare genua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpiter et nequiter facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:17:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille porro prave, nequiter, turpiter cenabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: si quā per voluptatem nequiter feceritis, voluptas cito abibit: nequiter factum illud apud vos semper manebit, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 1, 4</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum bellum susceptum sit nequius, an inconsultius gestum, dici non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:77:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 77, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nequaquam: <entryFree id="n30775" type="main" key="ne_qua_quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquāquam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>nec-quaquam</etym>, <sense id="n30775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in nowise, by no means, not at all</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nequaquam argenti ratio conparet tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: nequaquam istuc istac ibit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (Trag. v. 304 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut nequaquam fuerit illius commodi magnitudo cum eo incommodo comparanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir sibi nequaquam par,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequaquam omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 64, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc ad egrediendum nequaquam idoneum arbitratus locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera nequaquam simili ratione modoque Aestimat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequaquam satis in re unā consumere curam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 37, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neque: <entryFree id="n30776" type="main" key="ne^que"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕ-que</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">nec</orth> (used indifferently before vowels and consonants. The notion that nec in class. prose stands only before consonants is wholly unfounded. Ap. Cic. in the Rep. alone we find nec nineteen times before vowels; viz.: nec accipere, 3, 13, 23: nec alios, 2, 37, 62: nec enim, 1, 24, 38; 6, 25, 27: nec esset, 5, 5, 7: nec ex se, <cb n="NEQU" /> 6, 24, 27: <sense id="n30776.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">nec id, 1, 1, 1: nec inportatis, 2, 15, 29: nec in, 6, 23, 25: nec inconstantiam, 3, 11, 18: nec injussu, 6, 15, 15: nec ipsius, 1, 26, 41: nec ipsum, 6, 24, 27: nec ulla, 1, 34, 51: nec ullo, 1, 37, 58: nec una, 2, 1, 2: nec hic, 3, 33, 45: nec hominis, 2, 21, 37: nec hunc, 6, 25, 29. Cf. also such passages as neque reliquarum virtutum, nec ipsius rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabo tibi testes nec nimis antiquos nec ullo modo barbaros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec atrocius ... neque apertius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec homo occidi nec consulto, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 34</bibl></cit>. The true distinction is, that in the form nec the negation is more prominent; in the form neque, the connective force of the particle; cf. Hand, Turs. 4, p. 94 sq.), <pos>adv.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [ne-que], <hi rend="ital">not; and not, also not</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30776.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, like ne, in ante-class. Latinity (v. ne, I.) as a general negative particle, = non, <hi rend="ital">not</hi> (usually in the form nec. In class. Lat. this usage seems to be confined to certain formulae, as nec opinans, nec procul abesse, nec mancipi, etc.; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): nec conjunctionem grammatici fere dicunt esse disjunctivam, ut: nec legit, nec scribit: cum si diligentius inspiciatur, ut fecit Sinnius Capito, intellegi possit, eam positam esse ab antiquis pro non, ut et in XII. est: AST EI CVSTOS NEC ESCIT, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">SI INTESTATO MORITVR, CVI SVVS HERES NEC SIT, etc., Lex XII. Tab. (v. App. III. tab. 5): SI AGNATVS NEC ESCIT, etc., ib.: magistratus nec obedientem civem coërceto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatori, qui nec aderit, culpa esto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bruti nec satis sardare queunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:1:4" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:1:7" default="NO">1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu dis nec recte dicis: non aequum facis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec recte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 30, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter, qui nec procul aberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ullus = nullus: cui Parcae tribuere nec ullo vulnere laedi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 269</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">differentia mancipi rerum et nec mancipi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:18 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 18 sq.</bibl></cit> —Form neque: si quid tibi in illisce suovitaurilibus lactentibus neque satisfactum est, etc., an old formula of prayer in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141, 4</bibl>: neque opinantes insidiatores, Auct. B. Afr. 66; Auct. B. Alex. 75.</sense><sense id="n30776.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Conj.</hi>, in all periods and kinds of composition. </sense><sense id="n30776.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., = et non, <hi rend="ital">and not, also not</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30776.4" n="1" level="3"> Alone. </sense><sense id="n30776.5" n="(a)" level="5"> When the negative applies to the principal verb of the clause: multumque laborat, Nec respirandi fit copia, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 3</bibl> (Ann. v. 437 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">illa quae aliis sic, aliis secus, nec iisdem semper uno modo videntur, ficta esse dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delubra esse in urbibus censeo, nec sequor magos Persarum, quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mei testes dicunt, quia non viderunt nec sciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eros nec dominos appellabant eos ... sed patres et deos. Nec sine causā. Quid enim? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 41, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa, nec invideo, fruitur meliore marito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30776.6" n="(b)" level="5"> Less freq. when the negative applies to some other word: <cit><quote lang="la">nec inventas illas toto orbe pares vires gloriatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:9:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vidi et perii, nec notis ignibus arsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anguibus exuitur tenui cum pelle vetustas, Nec faciunt cervos cornua jacta senes ( = et faciunt non senes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eum aequom facere ait,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm, 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dubie ludibrio esse miserias suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 14, 2</bibl>; esp. in the phrases nec idcirco minus, nec eo minus, nec eo secius, neque eo magis; <cit><quote lang="la">thus: nec idcirco minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:35:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 35, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eo minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eo secius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eo magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eum. 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Paus. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum consules in Hernicos exercitum duxissent, neque inventis in agro hostibus, Ferentinum urbem cepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30776.7" n="2" level="3"> So, nec ullus, nec quisquam, for et nullus, et nemo, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ullo Gallorum ibi viro, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 25, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quidquam magis quam ille, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30776.8" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">vero, enim, autem, tamen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque vero hoc solum dixit, sed ipse et sentit et fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:53:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 53, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero jam meo nomine abstinent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: nec enim respexit, etc., id. Clod. et Cur. 4, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 10, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim tu is es, qui, qui sis nescias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen didici, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:38:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 38, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque autem ego sum ita demens, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30776.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n30776.10" n="1" level="3"> Nec <pb n="1202" /> <cb n="NEQU" /> = ne ... quidem, <hi rend="ital">not even</hi> (in Liv. and later writers; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. dub. since B. and K. read ne ... quidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Hand, Turs. 4, 105 sqq.): ne quid ex antiquo praeter sonum linguae, nec eum incorruptum, retinerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 33, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maharbal nec ipse eruptionem cohortium sustinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 52, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 32, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 20, 8</bibl>; 38, 23, 3; <cit><quote lang="la">40, 20, 6: non spes modo, sed nec dilatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:8:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam pauper, quam nec miserabilis Irus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:77:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 77, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:70:6" default="NO">5, 70, 6</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:151" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 151</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogatus, an facta hominum deos fallerent, nec cogitata, inquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:15:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 10, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30776.11" n="2" level="3"> Nec = etiam non (freq. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si in urbe fines non reguntur, nec aqua in urbe arceatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec si quid dicere satis non est, ideo nec necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in foro non expedit, illic nec liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:86" default="NO">5, 10, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:6" default="NO">12, 3, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 13, 7: sed neque haec in principem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 82</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30776.12" n="3" level="3"> Neque (nec) ... neque (nec), <hi rend="ital">neither ... nor</hi>: quae neque Dardaniis campis potuere perire, Nec cum capta capi, nec cum combusta cremari, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 360 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nam certe neque tum peccavi, cum ... neque cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec meliores nec beatiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors nec ad vivos pertineat nec ad mortuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus nec eripi nec surripi potest umquam: neque naufragio neque incendio amittitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: neque ego neque Caesar, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 20, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec si neque ego neque tu fecimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non ... nec ... neque ... neque: perspicuum est, non omni caussae, nec auditori neque personae neque tempori congruere orationis unum genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 210</bibl></cit>.—The second <hi rend="ital">nec</hi> is rarely placed after a word in the clause (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec deus hunc mensā, dea nec dignata cubili est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 365</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">696</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nec Brutus erit, Bruti nec avunculus usquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 43</bibl></cit>.—With a preceding negative, which, however, does not destroy the negation contained in neque ... neque: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediusfidius prae lacrimis possum reliqua nec cogitare nec scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnes intellegant, nihil me nec subterfugere voluisse reticendo nec obscurare dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla vitae pars neque publicis neque privatis, neque forensibus neque domesticis, neque si tecum agas, neque si cum altero contrahas vacare officio potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo umquam neque poëta neque orator fuit, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 20, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:50:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 50, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30776.13" n="4" level="3"> Neque (nec) ... et (que), and et ... neque (nec), when one clause is affirmative, <hi rend="ital">on the one hand not ... and on the other hand; not only not ... but also;</hi> or the contrary, <hi rend="ital">on the one hand ... and on the other hand not; not only ... but also not</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30776.14" n="a" level="4"> Neque (nec) ... et (que): <cit><quote lang="la">id neque amoris mediocris et ingenii summi et sapientiae judico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal nullum inveniri potest, quod neque natum umquam sit, et semper sit futurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:13:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 13, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:12:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 12, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 58, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo intellegitur nec intemperantiam propter se fugiendam esse temperantiamque expetendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perficiam, ut neque bonus quisquam intereat, paucorumque poenā vos omnes jam salvi esse possitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nec illa exstincta sunt, alunturque potius et augentur cogitatione et memoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">811</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30776.15" n="b" level="4"> Et ... neque (nec): <cit><quote lang="la">ego vero et exspectabo ea quae polliceris neque exigam nisi tuo commodo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patebat via et certa neque longa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegitis et animum ei praesto fuisse, nec consilium defuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ... nec ... et ... et,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:38:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 38, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30776.16" n="5" level="3"> Neque (nec) non (also in one word, necnon), emphatically affirmative, <hi rend="ital">and also, and besides, and indeed, and</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec haec non deminuitur scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque meam mentem non domum saepe revocat exanimata uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero non eadem ira deorum hanc ejus satellitibus injecit amentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 32, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero Aristoteles non laudandus in eo, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 44</bibl></cit>: neque tamen illa non ornant,<cb n="NEQU" />  habiti honores, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:85:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 85, 347</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tristius dicere quicquam debeo hac de re, neque non me tamen mordet aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non et sterilis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 461</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30776.17" n="b" level="4"> In Varro and after the Aug. per., nec non (or as one word, necnon) freq. as a simple conjunction = et, <hi rend="ital">and, and likewise, and so too, and also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi vidi greges magnos anserum, gallinarum, gruum, pavonum, necnon glirium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non et Tyrii per limina laeta frequentes Convenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 707</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 38, § 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non etiam poëmata faciebat ex tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non et ante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:23:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 23, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec non et quasi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 3, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30776.18" n="6" level="3"> Neque (nec) dum (also in one word, necdum), <hi rend="ital">and not yet, not yet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille autem quid agat, si scis neque dum Romā es profectus, scribas ad me velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26</bibl>, n. 33; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">necdum tamen ego Quintum conveneram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necdum etiam audierant inflari classica, necdum Impositos duris crepitare incudibus enses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 539</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 70</bibl>.—Strengthened by tamen: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi summi, neque dum tamen sapientiam consecuti, nonne intellegunt in summo se malo esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:28:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 28, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et necdum (post-Aug.),</quote> <trans><tr>and not yet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:14:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 14, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30776.19" n="7" level="3"> Nec ... quidem; v. quidem.—</sense><sense id="n30776.20" n="C" level="2"> Neque = et ne or neve. </sense><sense id="n30776.21" n="1" level="3"> Expressing negative purpose. </sense><sense id="n30776.22" n="(a)" level="5"> After <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea, quae regie statuit in aratores, praetermittam neque eos appellem, a quibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:48:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 48, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortemur liberos nostros, ut animo rei magnitudinem complectantur, neque eis praeceptis quibus utuntur omnes, ut consequi posse confidant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peterent ut dediticiis suis parcerent, neque in eum agrum arma inferrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52:11" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 52, 11</bibl>; 27, 20, 12.—</sense><sense id="n30776.23" n="(b)" level="5"> After <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">conspirāsse inde, ne manus ad os cibum ferrent, nec os acciperet datum, nec dentes conficerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 32, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4, 11</bibl>; 26, 42, 2.—</sense><sense id="n30776.24" n="2" level="3"> In a prohibition (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nec id mirati sitis, priusquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 53, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec a me nunc quisquam quaesiverit, quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam raptim aut forte temere egeritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30776.25" n="D" level="2"> In contrasts, <hi rend="ital">but not, not however</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi aetas tantum modo quaestui neque luxuriae modum fecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriosa modo neque belli patrandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 88, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus sine ulla patrum injuriā, nec sine offensione fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida oppugnata nec obsessa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nequedum: <entryFree id="n30777" type="main" key="ne^que^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕquĕdum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">necdum</orth>), v. neque, II. B. 6.</entryFree>
nequeo: <entryFree id="n30778" type="main" key="ne^que^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕquĕo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ĭi, ĭtum, 4</itype> (lengthened collat. form: nequinont pro nequeunt, ut solinunt, ferinunt, pro solent, et feriunt dicebant antiqui. Livius in Odysseā: partim errant, nequinont Graeciam redire, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll.—<sense id="n30778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Imperf.</hi> nequibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 56, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Fut.</hi> nequibunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 380</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. pres.</hi> nequiens, euntis: <cit><quote lang="la">Spartacus nequiens prohibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Fragm. p. 254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Fragm. p. 254</bibl></cit> Gerl.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nequiens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 207</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinere corpora plerique nequeuntes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nequeuntes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 239</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>nequeo: <cit><quote lang="la">libenter etiam copulando verba jungebant, ut sodes pro si audes, nequire pro non quire, malle pro magis velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 154</bibl></cit>; but Cic. himself always writes non queo in <hi rend="ital">first pers. pres.</hi></etym>, <hi rend="ital">not to be able, to be unable, I cannot</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n30778.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi habitaret, invenires saltem, si nomen nequis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 51</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequeo contineri quin loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actam aetatem meminisse nequimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecundae saepe nequissent uxores parere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pisces ire nequibunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea, cum velimus, laxare nequeamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:65:220" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 65, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Demosthenes rho dicere nequiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod proelio adesse nequibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 507</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers., it is impossible;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satin qui amat, nequit quin nihili sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30778.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi>: nequitum et nequitur pro non posse dicebant ut Plautus in Satyrione: retrahi nequitum, quoquo progressa est semel, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll.: ut nequitur<cb n="NERE" />  comprimi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid. quid sine sanguine civium ulcisci nequitur, jure factum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nequicquam: <entryFree id="n30779" type="main" key="ne_quicquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquicquam</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nēquidquam</orth>, v. nequiquam.</entryFree>
nequinates: <entryFree id="n30780" type="main" key="Nequi_na_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nequīnātes</orth>, v. Nequinum, II.</entryFree>
nequinont: <entryFree id="n30781" type="main" key="Ne^qui^nont"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕquĭnont</orth>, v. nequeo <sense id="n30781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nequinum: <entryFree id="n30782" type="main" key="Nequi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nequīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Umbria, on the site of which</hi> Narnia <hi rend="ital">afterwards stood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 113</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n30782.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nequīnātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Nequinum</hi>: Nequinates Narnienses, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=176" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 176</bibl> Müll.; Fast. Triumph. ap. Grut. 296, col. 2.</sense></entryFree>
nequior: <entryFree id="n30783" type="main" key="ne_qui^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquĭor</orth>, <itype>ius</itype>, v. nequam.</entryFree>
nequiquam: <entryFree id="n30784" type="main" key="ne_qui_quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquīquam</orth> (so in the best MSS.; not nequicquam; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 642 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 440</bibl> Brix.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 242</bibl> Lorenz), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ne-quiquam; cf.: nequiquam significare idem quod frustra, plurimis auctorum exemplis manifestum est, Paul. ex. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n30784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in vain, to no purpose, fruitlessly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne istuc nequiquam dixeris tam indignum dictum in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 108</bibl></cit>: qui ipse sibi sapiens prodesse non quit, nequiquam sapit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 310 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">et sero et nequiquam pudet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequiquam alicujus auxilium implorare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non nequiquam tantae virtutis homines judicari deberet ausos esse transire latissimum flumen,</quote> <trans><tr>without ground, without reason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequiquam deus abscidit oceano terras,</quote> <trans><tr>to no purpose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas nequiquam nectis inanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 219</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 403</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 78</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">438 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frustra ac nequiquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:77:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 77, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nequiquam frustra, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 41</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> in exclamation: <cit><quote lang="la">nequiquam!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:64:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 64, 4</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">without punishment, with impunity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne istuc nequiquam dixeris tam indignum dictum in me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nequis: <entryFree id="n30785" type="main" key="ne_quis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquis</orth> for <orth extent="full" lang="la">nē quis</orth>, v. 2. quis.</entryFree>
nequissimus: <entryFree id="n30786" type="main" key="ne_quissi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquissĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. nequam.</entryFree>
nequiter: <entryFree id="n30787" type="main" key="ne_qui^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nequam <sense id="n30787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nequitia: <entryFree id="n30788" type="main" key="ne_qui^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nēquĭtĭes</orth> (no <sense id="n30788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <case>dat.</case>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nequam</etym>, <hi rend="ital">bad quality, badness</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aceti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 125</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30788.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bad moral quality</hi>, of all degrees, <hi rend="ital">idleness, negligence, worthlessness, vileness</hi> (syn.: malitia, negligentia, ignavia, mollitia; class.). </sense><sense id="n30788.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Idleness, inactivity, remissness, negligence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ipsum inertiae nequitiaeque condemno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inertissimi homines, nescio quā singulari nequitiā praediti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30788.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lightness, levity, inconsiderateness</hi>: omnia mala probra flagitia, quae homines faciunt, in duabus rebus sunt, malitia atque nequitia. Si nequitiam defendere vis, licet, P. African. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:11:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 11, 9</bibl>; Auct. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Her.</author> 3, 6, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30788.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Prodigality, profusion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod filii nequitiam videret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 51, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum aut nequities ... expellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30788.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Profligacy, wantonness, lewdness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor pauperis Ibyci Tandem nequitiae pone modum tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:414" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 414</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 8, 15</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:42:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 42, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30788.6" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Worthlessness, vileness, wickedness, villany</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucurgus mihi quidem videtur posse hic ad nequitiam adducier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si domus haec habenda est potius, quam officina nequitiae et diversorium flagitiorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui istius insignem nequitiam, frontis involutam integumentis, nondum cernat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturae mala nequitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:216" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 216</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nequo: <entryFree id="n30789" type="hapax" key="ne_quo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nē-quō</orth> (better <orth extent="full" lang="la">nē quō</orth>), <sense id="n30789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., not to any place, no whither</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vilica ad cenam nequo eat, neque ambulatrix siet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 143, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neratius: <entryFree id="n30790" type="main" key="Ne^rati^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕratĭus Priscus</orth>, <sense id="n30790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated lawyer under Trajan</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 4</bibl> and 18.</sense></entryFree>
nereis: <entryFree id="n30791" type="main" key="Ne_re_^is1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērē^is</orth>, <itype>ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Nereid;</hi> v. Nereus, II. A.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30792" type="main" key="Ne_re_is" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the daughters of Priam</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 90" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30793" type="main" key="Ne_re_is2" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Pyrrhus, king of Epirus; the wife of Gelo, of Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 3, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nereius: <entryFree id="n30794" type="main" key="Ne_re_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Nereus, II. B.</entryFree>
neretum: <entryFree id="n30795" type="main" key="Ne^re_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕrētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Calabria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nardo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 51</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕrē-tīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Neretum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>. <pb n="1203" /> <cb n="NERS" /></sense></entryFree>
nereus: <entryFree id="n30796" type="main" key="Ne_reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēreus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>i and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nhreu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Oceanus and Tethys, a seagod, the husband of Doris, and father of the Nereids</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 742</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 33</bibl> (4, 6, 67); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 383</bibl>: Nerei filii, <hi rend="ital">sea-monsters</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 733</bibl> P. (Trag. v. 138 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 418</bibl> Forbig. ad loc.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 139</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30796.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">the sea</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placidum per Nerea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:58" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 58</bibl></cit>: quā totum Nereus circumtonat orbem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:450" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 450</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 713</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30796.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n30796.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērē^is</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter of Nereus, a sea-nymph, Nereia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virides Nereides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nereida colligit orbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequoreae Nereides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nereis caerula Thetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit> (5, 45).—Acc. to Hyg. Fab. praef. there were fifty of them; acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 33</bibl> (4, 6, 67), a hundred.—</sense><sense id="n30796.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Nereus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genetrix Nereia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <trans><tr>Phocus, grandson of Nereus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:685" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 685</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nereia Doto,</quote> <trans><tr>daughter of Nereus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nereia turba,</quote> <trans><tr>the Nereids</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:416" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nereia bacca,</quote> <trans><tr>pearls</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 591</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n30796.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērīnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = Nereis, <hi rend="ital">Nerine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nerine Galatea, thymo mihi dulcior Hyblae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 37</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30796.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = Nereïus, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Nereus, Nerine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nerinae aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>sea-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animantia Nerina,</quote> <trans><tr>fishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neria: <entryFree id="n30797" type="main" key="Ne_ria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēria</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērĭēnē</orth>, v. Nerio.</entryFree>
nerine: <entryFree id="n30798" type="main" key="Ne_ri_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērīnē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērīnus</orth>, v. Nereus, II. C. and D.</entryFree>
nerio: <entryFree id="n30799" type="main" key="Ne_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērĭo</orth>, <itype>ēnis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērĭēnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērĭēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>a Sabine word which signified bravery; v. Nero; hence, personified, in the Roman mythology</etym>, <sense id="n30799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the companion and wife of Mars; nom.</hi> Nerio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mars salutat Nerienem uxorem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: Nerienes, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 4</bibl> (Sat. Men. 83, 1): Neria Martis, Cn. Gell. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 13</bibl>: nolo ego Neaeram te vocent, sed Nerienem, Licinius Imbrex ap. Gell. l. l. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nerion: <entryFree id="n30800" type="greek" key="ne_ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nērĭon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nērĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nh/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n30800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the oleander</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rosebay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 20, 33, § 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:90" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 53, § 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nerita: <entryFree id="n30801" type="greek" key="ne_ri_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nērīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nhri/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n30801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-mussel resembling the nautilus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl> dub. (Sillig. and Jahn, Veneriae).</sense></entryFree>
neritos: <entryFree id="n30802" type="main" key="Ne_ri^to^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērĭtŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nh/ritos</foreign>, <sense id="n30802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Ithaca, and an island in its vicinity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neritos ardua saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 856" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 856</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30802.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nērĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Neritos, Neritian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Ithacean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macareus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 159</bibl></cit>; also for <hi rend="ital">Ulyssean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neritia proles,</quote> <trans><tr>the Saguntines, because they emigrated from the Cephallenian islands</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:317" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 317</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neritia ratis,</quote> <trans><tr>the ship of Ulysses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ulysses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Ulysses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 712</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nerius: <entryFree id="n30803" type="main" key="Ne^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n30803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. So Cn. Nerius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 5</bibl>.—Perh. the same, celebrated as a usurer, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 69</bibl>; v. Wüstem. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
nero: <entryFree id="n30804" type="main" key="Ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>a Sabine word, = fortis; cf. Nerio = fortitudo; root nar; Sanscr. naras, man; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)nh/r</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">h)nore/h</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n30804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a family name in the</hi> gens Claudia, whose most famous member was the emperor C. Claudius Nero, Tac. A. l<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12</bibl>-16 passim; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:223" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:129" default="NO">12, 129</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n30804.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n30804.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕrōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Neronian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensem quoque Aprilem Neroneum appellavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <trans><tr>the warm baths of Nero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <trans><tr>the games in the Grecian manner instituted by Nero</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">agon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30804.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕrōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Nero, Neronian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Neronianum dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 248</bibl></cit>: piscina, perh. <hi rend="ital">laid out after the pattern of the fish-ponds of Nero, near Baiæ</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 2, 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30804.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕrōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Patrobius Neronianus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30804.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕrōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Neronian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neropolis: <entryFree id="n30805" type="main" key="Ne^ro^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕrŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ne/rwn-po/lis</foreign>, <sense id="n30805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name which Nero intended to give to the city of Rome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">destinavit et Romam Neropolin nuncupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:55" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nersae: <entryFree id="n30806" type="main" key="Nersae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nersae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient city of the Æqui</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:744" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 744</bibl>. <cb n="NERV" /></sense></entryFree>
nersia: <entryFree id="n30807" type="main" key="Nersi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nersĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Etruscan goddess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nerthus: <entryFree id="n30808" type="main" key="Nerthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nerthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <etym>Old Germ. nirdu; cf. Sanscr. narakas, underworld; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/neroi</foreign></etym>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess of the ancient Germans, the Earth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40, 4</bibl>; v. Orell. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
nertobriga: <entryFree id="n30809" type="main" key="Nertobriga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nertobriga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n30809.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Hispania Bætica, surnamed</hi> Concordia Julia, now <hi rend="ital">Valera la Vieja</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30809.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of Celtiberia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Almunia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17:10" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nerulum: <entryFree id="n30810" type="main" key="Neru^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nerŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified city in Lucania, Rotondo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 20, 9</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30810.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nerŭlōnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Nerulum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
