nerva: <entryFree id="n30811" type="main" key="Nerva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nerva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman family name of the</hi> Licinii, Cocceii, <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Silii. So M. Cocceius Nerva, <hi rend="ital">the Roman emperor</hi>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30811.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nervĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the emperor Nerva, Nervian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Nervian legion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 421</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nervalis: <entryFree id="n30812" type="main" key="nerva_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nervālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nervus</etym>, <sense id="n30812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the nerves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. 12" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nerviae: <entryFree id="n30813" type="main" key="nervi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nervĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nervĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. nervus</etym>, <sense id="n30813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chords</hi> of a musical instrument, <hi rend="ital">gut-strings</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 215, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30813.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">nerves</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 215, 16</bibl> (Sat. Men. 63, 4); <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nerviceus: <entryFree id="n30814" type="greek" key="nervi^ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nervĭcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nervus</etym>, <sense id="n30814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of sinews</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervicei funes = nerviae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 16, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nervicus: <entryFree id="n30815" type="main" key="nervi^cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nervĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has a nervous disorder, nervous</hi> (al. neuricos), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n30816" type="main" key="Nervi^cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nervĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Nervii, II.</entryFree>
nervii: <entryFree id="n30817" type="main" key="Nervi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nervĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Belgic Gaul</hi>, in the modern <hi rend="ital">Hainault</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 428</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30817.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nervĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nervian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nervinus: <entryFree id="n30818" type="main" key="nervi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nervīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nervus</etym>, <sense id="n30818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of sinews</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervini funes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nervius: <entryFree id="n30819" type="main" key="Nervi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nervĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Nerva, II.</entryFree>
nervolaria: <entryFree id="n30820" type="main" key="Nervo^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nervŏlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the title of a lost comedy of Plautus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nervose: <entryFree id="n30821" type="main" key="nervo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nervōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nervosus <sense id="n30821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nervositas: <entryFree id="n30822" type="main" key="nervo_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nervōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nervosus</etym>, <sense id="n30822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strength, thickness;</hi> of a thread, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 9</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of the body,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:1:21" default="NO">5, 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nervosus: <entryFree id="n30823" type="main" key="nervo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nervōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nervus</etym>, <sense id="n30823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of sinews, sinewy, nervous</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30823.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervosa et lignea dorcas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 86, § 214</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 3, 34, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervosius illud, i. e. membrum virile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30823.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">full of fibres, fibrous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauliculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 9, 30, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:123" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 12, 97, § 123</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30823.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30823.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Nervous, vigorous, energetic</hi> in expression: <cit><quote lang="la">quis Aristotele nervosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 31, 121</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30823.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Vigorous, bold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivacitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:13:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: juventus, Prud. c. Sym. 2, 320.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nervō-sē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">strongly, boldly, vigorously, energetically</hi>: vigilanter nervoseque aliquem subornare, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervosius dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 36, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervosius aliquid disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nervulus: <entryFree id="n30824" type="main" key="nervu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nervŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nerve, strength, vigor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tu nervulos tuos mihi saepe cognitos ... adhibueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, § 13.</sense></entryFree>
nervus: <entryFree id="n30825" type="main" key="nervus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nervus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root snar-; Old Germ. snara, a snare; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">neu=ron</foreign>; cf. parvus and <foreign lang="greek">pau=ros</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n30825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sinew, tendon, nerve</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30825.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">his adde nervos, a quibus artus continentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:139" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc nervos confirmari putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervus qui platys appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 58, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic primum nervos et venas expressit (of Pythagoras the painter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervorum contractio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:40" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 40</bibl></cit>: nervi quos <foreign lang="greek">te/nontas</foreign> Graeci appellant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">condamus alter alterum in nervum bracchialem,</quote> <trans><tr>let us embrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 99</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30825.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30825.3" n="1" level="3"> I. q. membrum virile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:205" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:35" default="NO">9, 35</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">pl.</hi> nervi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 131</bibl>, §§ 4 and 6.—</sense><sense id="n30825.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A string of a musical instrument</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes voces, ut nervi in fidibus, ita sonant, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotidiano cantu vocum et nervorum et tibiarum tota vicinitas personat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 776</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30825.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bowstring</hi>: reciproca tendens nervo equino concita tela, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=80" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 80</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 176 Rib.): nervoque<cb n="NESC" />  obversus equino Contendit telum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 622</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervo aptare sagittas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erumpit nervo pulsante sagitta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 313</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:376" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 376</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:437" default="NO">1, 437</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 141</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30825.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A bow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem fallere nervo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:182" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30825.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The leather</hi> with which shields were covered: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta nervo firmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:293" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 293</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30825.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A thong</hi> with which a person was bound, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30825.9" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The cords</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wires</hi> by which a puppet is moved: <cit><quote lang="la">duceris ut nervis alienis mobile lignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30825.10" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fetter</hi>: nervum appellamus etiam ferreum vinculum, quo pedes impediuntur: quamquam Plautus eo etiam cervices vinciri ait: Perfidiose captus edepol nervo cervices probat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=165" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 165</bibl> Müll.: VINCITO AVT NERVO, AVT COMPEDIBVS, Lex XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1</bibl>: in nervo atque compedibus aetatem agunt, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 18</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">posuit in nervo pedes meos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 33, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30825.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A prison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nervum aliquem rapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nervo jacebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vereor ne istaec fortitudo in nervum erumpat denique,</quote> <trans><tr>will lay you by the heels, bring you into durance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximere de nervo aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misit in nervum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30825.12" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30825.13" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Nerve, vigor, force, power, strength</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digna res est ubi tu nervos intendas tuos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus ... dignum, in quo omnes nervos aetatis industriaeque meae contenderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus nervis mihi contendendum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 56</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">130: opibus ac nervis ad perniciem suam uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 12, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi belli pecunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalia nervos esse rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionum nervos incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae molliunt animos, nervos omnes virtutis elidunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video, fore nervis opus sapientiāque tuā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci inhaerentes in nervis causarum,</quote> <trans><tr>intimately connected with them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:27:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 27, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi conjurationis,</quote> <trans><tr>the leaders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 39, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30825.14" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of expression, <hi rend="ital">force, energy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum oratio neque nervos, neque aculeos oratorios ac forenses habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 19, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi in dicendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sectantem levia nervi Deficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nesaee: <entryFree id="n30826" type="main" key="Ne_saee_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēsaeē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nhsai/h</foreign>, <sense id="n30826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Nereids</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 826</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nesapius: <entryFree id="n30827" type="main" key="ne^sa^pi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĕsăpĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ne-sapio</etym>, <sense id="n30827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwise, foolish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 50, 5</bibl>; cf. Ter. Scaurus de Orthogr, p. 2251 P.</sense></entryFree>
nesciens: <entryFree id="n30828" type="main" key="nesci^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nescĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. nescio <sense id="n30828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nescienter: <entryFree id="n30829" type="main" key="nesci^enter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nescĭenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nescio, <sense id="n30829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
nescientia: <entryFree id="n30830" type="main" key="nesci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nescĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n30830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [nescio], <hi rend="ital">ignorance</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nescio: <entryFree id="n30831" type="main" key="nesci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ne-scĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <sense id="n30831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., not to know, to be ignorant</hi> (syn. ignoro): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc nescire sat scio de illā amicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis cui maledicas nunc viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me pudet fateri nescire, quod nesciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Oropo opinor, sed certum nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nobis agendum sit, nescio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima sit (animus) ignisve, nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis quantā cum expectatione sim te auditurus,</quote> <trans><tr>you cannot think</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescis, temeraria, nescis, Quem fugias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 514</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis omnia de te Quaerere, si nescis, maxima cura fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 17, 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">20, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod scis or scies, nescis, a formula used in advising another to keep a secret: ne tu hercle linguam comprimes Posthac: etiam illud quod scies nesciveris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu nescis id quod scis, Dromo, si sapies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 4, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 55</bibl>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescibam id dicere illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescit Agenorides natam parvumque nepotem Aequoris esse deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 562</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">nescire Tarquinios privatos vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens, quae victa quiescere nesciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:4" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 51, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 330:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 330, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30831.1" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum consistere uspiam velit an mare transire nescitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talibus locis pruinarum vis et natura nescitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lis antea nescita,</quote> <trans><tr>unknown</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30831.2" n="(g)" level="5"> Nescio quis, nescio quid, nescio quomodo, nescio an, used in an assertion to express uncertainty with regard to some particular contained<pb n="1204" /> <cb n="NESC" />  in it; and usually without influencing the mood of the following verb: nescio quis, <hi rend="ital">I know not who, some one, somebody, a certain person</hi>: nescio quid, <hi rend="ital">I know not what, something, some, a certain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prope me hic nescio quis loquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid profecto mihi animus praesagit mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi me forte Paconii nescio cujus querelis moveri putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o pastores nescio quos cupidos litterarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flacc. 17, 39</bibl></cit>; in affected ignorance, to denote that a thing is <hi rend="ital">insignificant, small, mean</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse non jejunum hoc nescio quid quod ego gessi, et contemnendum videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nescio quid in philosophiā dissentiret,</quote> <trans><tr>a little</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 33, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid litterularum,</quote> <trans><tr>a short letter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumoris nescio quid afflavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causidicum nescio quem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 46, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid e quercu exsculpseram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae nescio unde ex abdito erutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 24, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quid etiam de Locrorum proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mente nescio quā effrenatā atque praecipiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud nescio quod non fortuitum, sed divinum videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: nescio quid praeclarum, <hi rend="ital">remarkable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">extraordinary excellence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 7, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit enim, nescio quomodo, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>I know not how</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:146" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni nescio quomodo tardiores sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:47:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 47, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, nescio quo modo, conspirant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Thras. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">casu nescio quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii nescio quo pacto obduruerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ita fato nescio quo contigisse arbitror, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contra rem suam me nescio quando venisse questus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: nescio an, <hi rend="ital">I know not whether, probably, perhaps</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constantiam dico? nescio an melius patientiam possim dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin illam alteram, nescio an amplius mihi negotii contrahatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens eo die res et nescio an maxima illo bello gesta sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 16</bibl></cit>; v. the art. an.—</sense><sense id="n30831.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n30831.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not to know, to be unacquainted with</hi> a person or thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">illa illum nescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nescire hiemem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum toto nescire Decembri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to abstain from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30831.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not to understand; to be unable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam praeclarum est scire Latine, quam turpe nescire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 37, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:188" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare loco nescit, said of a horse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescit vox missa reverti,</quote> <trans><tr>cannot be unsaid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 390</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30831.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be incapable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoici omnino irasci nesciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:18:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nesciat irasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:360" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 360</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nescĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., unknowing, ignorant, unaware</hi> (class. nescius): <cit><quote lang="la">ut nescientem sentiat te id sibi dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nesciens sui,</quote> <trans><tr>unconscious</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 301, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nescĭenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">unknowingly, ignorantly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 2:40" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 2, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nescitus: <entryFree id="n30832" type="main" key="nesci_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nescītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of nescio.</entryFree>
nescius: <entryFree id="n30833" type="main" key="nesci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nescĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ne-scio</etym>, <sense id="n30833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unknowing, ignorant, unaware</hi> (syn.: inscius, ignarus).—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescia mens hominum fati sortisque futurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impendentis mali nescius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 23, 8</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 140</bibl>.—With a <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescia, quae faceret subitos mihi causa dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arvaque Cyclopum, quid rastra, quid usus aratri, Nescia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 2</bibl></cit>. —With a preced. <hi rend="ital">neg.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tamen, cum haec scribebam, eram nescius, quantis oneribus premerere susceptarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sum nescius, Scaevola, ista inter Graecos dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non eram nescius, fore, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 11, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30833.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Not knowing how, not understanding, unable;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nescii fari pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedere nescius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescia fallere vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graias mirari artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:100" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinci nescius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura mutari nescia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:240" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 240</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30833.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass., not known, unknown</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): in locis nesciis nesciā spe sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nescĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an unknown thing, a piece of ignorance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquid nescibo, id nescium tradam tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: neque nescium habebat, Anteium invisum<cb n="NEUR" />  Neroni, <hi rend="ital">nor was he ignorant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nesebis: <entryFree id="n30834" type="main" key="Nesebis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nesebis</orth>, v. Nisibis.</entryFree>
nesi: <entryFree id="n30835" type="gloss" key="nesi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nesi</orth>, <itype>pro sine positum est in lege dedicationis arae Dianae Aventinensis</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=165" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 165</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
nesimachus: <entryFree id="n30836" type="main" key="Ne_si^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēsĭmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Hippomedon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 70" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nesiotae: <entryFree id="n30837" type="main" key="Ne_sio_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēsiōtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Cephalenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nesis: <entryFree id="n30838" type="main" key="Ne_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nēsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> ĭdem and ĭda), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nhsi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the bay of Naples, between Naples and Puteoli</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nisita</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 51, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:148" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nesseus: <entryFree id="n30839" type="main" key="Nesse_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nessēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Nessus, III.</entryFree>
nession: <entryFree id="n30840" type="main" key="nessi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nessĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, the</hi> centaurium majus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nessotrophium: <entryFree id="n30841" type="greek" key="nessotro^phi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nessotrŏphīum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nessotrŏ-phēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nessotrofeion</foreign>, <sense id="n30841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where ducks are reared, a duck-yard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nessus: <entryFree id="n30842" type="main" key="Nessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nessus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ne/ssos</foreign>. <sense id="n30842.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Thrace</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Mesto</hi> or (Turkish) <hi rend="ital">Karasu</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 29, 6</bibl>; also called <hi rend="ital">Nestos</hi> ( = <foreign lang="greek">*ne/stos</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30842.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Centaur, who, on offering violence to Dejanira, was slain by Hercules with a poisoned arrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:101 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 101 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 34" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 34</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30842.2" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nessēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Nessus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <trans><tr>with the blood of Nessus, poisoned by the arrow of Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palla tabe Nesseā illita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 716" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 716</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nestis: <entryFree id="n30843" type="greek" key="nestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nestis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nh=stis</foreign>, <sense id="n30843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the second part of the small intestines;</hi> Lat. intestinum jejunum, so called because always found empty: <cit><quote lang="la">nestide paralysi vitiata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:11" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:10:100" default="NO">5, 10, 100</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nestor: <entryFree id="n30844" type="main" key="Nestor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nestor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype> (Gr. <case>acc.</case> Nestora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 22</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ne/stwr</foreign>, <sense id="n30844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Neleus, and king of Pylus, famous among the heroes before Troy for his wisdom and eloquence. He is said to have lived through three generations of men</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi Agamemnoni, regi regum, fuit honestum, habere aliquem in consiliis capiendis Nestorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 10, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet eloquio fidum quoque Nestora vincat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:10:46" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 10, 46</bibl> (3, 5, 30); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 49</bibl>.—Nestoris aetas, <hi rend="ital">the age of Nestor</hi>, prov. for <hi rend="ital">a long life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:64:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 64, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:96:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 96, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:58:5 al" default="NO">5, 58, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivat Pacuvius, quaeso, vel Nestora totum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a whole life of Nestor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 128</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30844.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nestŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Nestor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:30:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 30, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:110" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 110</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nestorius: <entryFree id="n30845" type="main" key="Nesto^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nestŏrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a theologian who was condemned as a heretic at the Council of Ephesus</hi>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nestŏrĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the followers of Nestorius, the Nestorians</hi>, Cod. 1, 5, 8; 16, 5, 66.</sense></entryFree>
nestos: <entryFree id="n30846" type="main" key="Nestos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nestos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Nessus, I.</entryFree>
nete: <entryFree id="n30847" type="greek" key="ne_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nētē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nh)th</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">xordh/</foreign>), <sense id="n30847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the undermost</hi> or <hi rend="ital">last string</hi> of a musical instrument, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the highest note</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
netinenses: <entryFree id="n30848" type="main" key="Ne_ti_nenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nētīnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. Netum, A</entryFree>
netini: <entryFree id="n30849" type="main" key="Ne_ti_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nētīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Netum, B.</entryFree>
netoides: <entryFree id="n30850" type="greek" key="ne_to^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nētŏīdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nhtoeidh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a musical key</hi>: netoides, quae et <foreign lang="greek">nomiko/s</foreign> consuevit vocari, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 965 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
netum: <entryFree id="n30851" type="main" key="Ne_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n30851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Sicily, south-west of Syracuse</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Noto Vecchio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:26:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 26, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:268" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 268</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30851.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nētī-nenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Netum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:65:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 65, § 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30851.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nētīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Netum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:22:section=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 22, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
netus: <entryFree id="n30852" type="main" key="ne_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from neo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30853" type="main" key="ne_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nētus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>neo</etym>, <sense id="n30853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thread, yarn</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neu: <entryFree id="n30854" type="main" key="neu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neu</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. neve.</entryFree>
neuras: <entryFree id="n30855" type="greek" key="neuras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neuras</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nevras</orth>), <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">neura/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30855.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The plant</hi> manicon, <hi rend="ital">which excites the nerves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 179</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30855.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant, called also</hi> poterion: <cit><quote lang="la">poterion, aut ut alii vocant, phrynion, vel nevras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 97, § 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neuri: <entryFree id="n30856" type="main" key="Neuri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Neuri</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Neuroe</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*neuroi/</foreign>, <sense id="n30856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in European Scythia regarded as magicians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 7</bibl> and 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 663</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 14</bibl>.— In <number>sing.</number> (collect.): <cit><quote lang="la">et raptor agrorum Neurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:121" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 5, 481</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 324</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neuricus: <entryFree id="n30857" type="main" key="neuri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neurĭcus</orth>, v. 1. nervicus.</entryFree>
neurobata: <entryFree id="n30858" type="greek" key="neuro^ba^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neurŏbăta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-es</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">neuroba/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n30858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who dances on a thin cord, a</hi> <cb n="NEVE" /> <hi rend="ital">cord-dancer</hi> (diff. from funambulus, one who dances on a stout rope): <cit><quote lang="la">nam et neurobaten exhibuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Car. 19, 2</bibl></cit>; Firm. Math. 8, 17.</sense></entryFree>
neuroides: <entryFree id="n30859" type="greek" key="neuro^i_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neurŏīdes</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">neuroeide/s</foreign>, <sense id="n30859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wild beet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 28, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neurospaston: <entryFree id="n30860" type="greek" key="neurospaston"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neurospaston</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">neuro/spaston</foreign>, <sense id="n30860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figure set in motion by strings, a puppet, marionette</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:23" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 23</bibl> (by others written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
neurospastos: <entryFree id="n30861" type="greek" key="neurospastos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neurospastos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">neuro/spastos</foreign>, <sense id="n30861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wild-brier, dog-rose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 14, 74, § 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neuter: <entryFree id="n30862" type="main" key="neuter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neuter</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype> (<sense id="n30862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> neutri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 62</bibl>, acc. to the MSS.; cf. §§ 55 and 58; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 50</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and by grammarians always in the phrase neutri generis,</quote> <trans><tr>of the neuter gender</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 13</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 277</bibl> P. al.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 449</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi> neutrae, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 678</bibl>.—Collat. form, NECVTER, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4859</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ne-uter</etym>, <hi rend="ital">neither the one nor the other, neither</hi> of two: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neutri illorum quisquam esset me carior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in neutram partem moveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 42, 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 6, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debemus neutrum eorum contra alium juvare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid bonum sit, quid malum, quid neutrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 378</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita fiet ut neutra lingua alteri officiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—Repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">neuter neutri invidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 49</bibl></cit>.—With verb in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut caveres, neuter ad me iretis cum querimoniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia neuter consulum potuerant bello abesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 44, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30862.1" n="(b)" level="5"> In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo neutrorum contemnenda est sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutri alteros primo cernebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 46, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita neutris cura posteritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in neutris partibus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutris quicquam hostile facientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:7:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30862.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in gram.: neutra nomina, <hi rend="ital">of the neuter gender</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutra (nomina or verba),</quote> <trans><tr>which are neither active nor passive, middle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 15</bibl> et saep. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n30862.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">‡ neutrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">neutrally; in neither way</hi>: neutre, <foreign lang="greek">ou)dete/rws</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.—</sense><sense id="n30862.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">neutrō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., to neither one side nor the other; to neither side, neither way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutro inclinatā spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutro inclinaverat fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si neutro litis condicio praeponderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neutiquam: <entryFree id="n30863" type="main" key="neuti^quam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ne-utĭquam</orth> (mostly ante-class.; not in Cæs., Quint., Plin., Suet.; very rare in Cic. and Liv.; v. Hand, Turs. 3, p. 182 sq.; by Enn., Plaut., and Ter. written as two words, <orth extent="full" lang="la">ne ŭtiquam</orth>), <sense id="n30863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., by no means, in nowise; not altogether, not exactly, not quite</hi>: mihi ne utiquam cor consentit cum oculorum aspectu, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 17, 52</bibl> (Trag. v. 56 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 3, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ne utiquam mihi placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indissolubiles vos quidem esse potestis, neutiquam tamen dissolvemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tim. 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 12, 42</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictatori neutiquam placebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specimen neutiquam volgatae laudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 27, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
neutique: <entryFree id="n30864" type="main" key="neuti^que_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ne-utĭquē</orth>, <sense id="n30864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., by no means</hi> (postclass.), Cod. Th. 15, 2, 3.</sense></entryFree>
neutralis: <entryFree id="n30865" type="main" key="neutra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neutrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>neuter</etym>, in gram., of the gender of substantives, <sense id="n30865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neuter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">positio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 54</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">neutrālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">as a neuter;</hi> Gellius fora navium neutraliter dixit, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 55</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
neutre: <entryFree id="n30866" type="main" key="neutre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neutrē</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">neutrō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. neuter <sense id="n30866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
neutrubi: <entryFree id="n30867" type="main" key="neutru^bi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">neutrŭbi</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>neuter-ubi</etym>. * <sense id="n30867.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In neither place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30867.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neither way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutrubi proelio inclinato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">24, 2, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neve: <entryFree id="n30868" type="main" key="ne_ve"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nē-ve</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">neu</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, introduces a negative clause containing a purpose, command, or prohibition, esp. after ut, ne, etc., <sense id="n30868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">and not, nor, and that not, and lest</hi>: utinam ne in nemore, etc.... neve inde, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 22, 34</bibl> (Trag. v. 282 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">caveto ne quam materiam doles, neu caedas, neu tangas, nisi siccam, neu gelidam, neu rorulentam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eam ne quis nobis minuat, neve vivus, neve mortuus,</quote> <trans><tr>neither ... nor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortatus est, uti suae pristinae virtutis memoriam retinerent, neu perturbarentur animo,</quote> <trans><tr>and that not</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut earum rerum vis minueretur, neu ponti nocerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—So after a <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi> alone: ipse <pb n="1205" /> <cb n="NEXU" /> modo Aeneas ... adveniat, voltus neve exhorrescat amicos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 263</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ames dici pater atque princeps, Neu sinas Medos equitare inultos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 50</bibl></cit>.—After an <hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
neverita: <entryFree id="n30869" type="main" key="Neveri^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Neverĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-goddess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nevolo: <entryFree id="n30870" type="main" key="ne_vo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nēvŏlo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nēvīs</orth>, etc., v. nolo.</entryFree>
nevras: <entryFree id="n30871" type="main" key="nevras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nevras</orth>, <itype>adis</itype>, v. neuras.</entryFree>
nex: <entryFree id="n30872" type="main" key="nex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nex</orth>, <itype>nĕcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>neco</etym>, <sense id="n30872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">death</hi> (syn.: mors, letum). </sense><sense id="n30872.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30872.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A violent death, murder, slaughter</hi> (cf.: caedes, occisio): mater terribilem minatur vitae cruciatum et necem, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:58:218" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 58, 218</bibl> (Trag. v. 44 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">insidiatori et latroni, quae potest esse injusta nex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem sibi consciscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae necisque potestatem habere in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem comminari alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neci dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neci demittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neci mittere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 513</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neci dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem alicui parare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neci occumbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 499</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eripere necem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:69" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscere neces,</quote> <trans><tr>to murder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:381" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 381</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravi nece urgere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1833" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1833</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">devotus neci,</quote> <trans><tr>doomed to death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 693" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Thyest. 693</bibl></cit>: vitae necisque potestas, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 4, 8, 1.—</sense><sense id="n30872.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum civium neces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30872.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30872.5" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">death, a natural death</hi> (rare and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">post necem Mithridatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post necem consulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata nobis sensum nostrae necis auferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 21:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 21, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30872.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the blood of the slain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(manūs) imbutae Phrygia nece,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 714</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30872.7" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">destruction, ruin</hi>, = pernicies, exitium (jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in necem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:4:5" default="NO">36, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1:21" default="NO">15, 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nexabunde: <entryFree id="n30873" type="hapax" key="nexa_bunde_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nexābundē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>nexo</etym>, <sense id="n30873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a straitened</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scanty manner; comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victitare nexabundius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 1, 2</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
nexibilis: <entryFree id="n30874" type="main" key="nexi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nexĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>necto</etym>, <sense id="n30874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tied</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bound together</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n30874.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 5, 10</bibl></cit> (dub.; al. vexabilia).—</sense><sense id="n30874.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nexilis: <entryFree id="n30875" type="main" key="nexi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nexĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tied</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bound together</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hederae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nexilitas: <entryFree id="n30876" type="main" key="nexi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nexĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nexilis</etym>, <sense id="n30876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a connection</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nexio: <entryFree id="n30877" type="main" key="nexi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nexĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>necto</etym>, <sense id="n30877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">binding together, a fastening</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vinculorum nexiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, § 226</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nexo: <entryFree id="n30878" type="main" key="nexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nexo</orth>, <itype>xŭi and xi, 3</itype> (also of the first conj., acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 9, 6, 33, p. 860 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 8, 48</bibl>, p. 904; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 1, p. 366</bibl>; <sense id="n30878.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and in the reading: nexantem nodis seque in sua membra plicantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 279</bibl></cit> Conington; but here the better reading is nixantem, Rib. and Forbig. ad loc.; cf. also Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 421 sq.), <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to tie</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bind together, to interlace, entwine</hi> (ante-class.): nexebant multa inter se, Liv. Andr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 366</bibl> P., and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 861</bibl> P.: omnibus manicas neximus, Att. ib. (Trag. Rel. v. 130 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
nexum: <entryFree id="n30879" type="main" key="nexum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nexum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. nexus, II.</entryFree>
nexuosus: <entryFree id="n30880" type="main" key="nexuo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nexuōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>nexus</etym>, <sense id="n30880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of windings, much interlaced</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 40</bibl> Fig.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: nexuosissimae quaestionem minutiae, <hi rend="ital">excessively involved</hi> or <hi rend="ital">complicated</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. Anim. 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nexus: <entryFree id="n30881" type="main" key="nexus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from necto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30882" type="main" key="nexus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nexus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>necto</etym>, <sense id="n30882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tying</hi> or <hi rend="ital">binding together, a fastening, joining, an interlacing, entwining, clasping</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30882.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">et jam contulerant arto luctantia nexu Pectora pectoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 242</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchiorum nexibus elidere aliquem (of a wrestler),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens, baculum qui nexibus ambit,</quote> <trans><tr>coils, folds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 659</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 11, 11, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salix solido ligat nexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 69, § 177</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30882.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (with the collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">nexum</orth>, i; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">the state</hi> or <hi rend="ital">condition of a</hi> nexus (v. necto, I. B.), <hi rend="ital">a personal obligation, an addiction</hi> or <hi rend="ital">voluntary assignment of the person for debt, slavery for debt</hi>: nexum Manilius scribit, omne, quod per libram et aes geritur, in quo sint mancipia. Mutius, quae per aes et libram fiant, <cb n="NI" /> ut obligentur, praeter quae mancipio dentur. Hoc verius esse, ipsum verbum ostendit, de quo quaeritur; <cit><quote lang="la">nam idem quod obligatur per libram neque suum fit, inde nexum dictum. Liber qui suas operas in servitutem pro pecuniā quādam debebat, dum solveret, nexus vocatur, ut ab aere obaeratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=105" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 105</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">abalienatio est ejus rei, quae mancipi est, aut traditio alteri nexu, aut in jure cessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVOM NEXVM FACIET, etc., Lex XII. Tab.: qui se nexu obligavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nexum inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec civili nexu sed communi lege naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 26</bibl></cit> Mos. (B. and K., nexo): <cit><quote lang="la">Attici proprium te esse scribis mancipio et nexo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:30:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sunt propter unius libidinem omnia nexa civium liberata nectierque postea desitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non sustulerit horum nexa atque hereditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:35:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 35, 102</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30882.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a legal obligation</hi> of any kind: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptilatio est liberatio per mutuam interrogationem, quā utriusque contigit ab eodem nexu absolutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem hereditatis a nexu pignoris liberam consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2:33" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n30882.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis (= vincula, nodi),</quote> <trans><tr>obligations, restraints</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v.
