Orell. ad h. l.: nexus naturalium causarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum latentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 11, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ni: <entryFree id="n30883" type="main" key="ni_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī</orth> (old orthography <orth extent="full" lang="la">nei</orth>, <sense id="n30883.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <pos>adv.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">conj.</hi> [identical with ne and the prim. form, whence nisi, i. e. si ni]. </sense><sense id="n30883.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, like ne, an absolutely negative particle, <hi rend="ital">not.</hi>—So only in the combinations, </sense><sense id="n30883.2" n="A" level="2"> Quid ni? or, in one word, quidni? <hi rend="ital">why not?</hi> quid ego ni ita censeam? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego ni fleam?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: quidni, inquit, meminerim? etc., Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 273</bibl> et saep.; v. quidni.— </sense><sense id="n30883.3" n="B" level="2"> Nimirum, lit. not wonderful; v. nimirum.—</sense><sense id="n30883.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Conj.</hi>, like ne, in imperative and intentional clauses, <hi rend="ital">not, that not</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ni quid tibi hinc in spem referas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: vinum aliudve quid ni laudato, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 281, 31</bibl>: Numa constituit, ut pisces, qui squamosi non essent, ni pollucerent ... ni qui ad polluctum emerent, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 10, § 20</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">QVEM QVISQVE EORVM AGRVM POSIDEBIT, INVITIS EIS NIQVIS SICET NIVE PASCAT NIVE FRVATVR, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3121, p. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">IS EVM AGRVM NEI HABETO NIVE FRVIMINO, ib.: ROGO PER DEOS, NI VELITIS OSSA MEA VIOLARE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 996, 12</bibl></cit>; Cenotaph. Pis. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 643</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lege) edictā flemus diu, ni nos divideret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstabat vallum, ni instent acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:374" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 374</bibl></cit> (al. ne): <cit><quote lang="la">monent ... ni teneant cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 686</bibl></cit> (antiqui ni pro ne ponebant, Serv. ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n30883.5" n="III" level="1"> As a conditional negative (= si non, nisi), <hi rend="ital">if not, unless, but that</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30883.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n30883.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>: SI IN IVS VOCAT, NI IT, ANTESTATOR, IGITVR EM CAPITO, <hi rend="ital">if he summon him before court, if he go not, then he shall</hi>, etc., Tab. XII. 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ni illum recipit, nihil est quo me recipiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni offerumentas habebis plures in tergo tuo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum ni domi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moriar ni puto, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni frustra augurium vani docuere parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si is homo moritur, probe factum ... ni moritur, tum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 10, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes">13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30883.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: quid ploras, pater?—Mirum ni cantem: condemnatus sum, <hi rend="ital">it's a wonder I don't sing</hi> (ironically), Nov. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 279</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicerem, quae ante futura dixissem, ni vererer, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni ita se res haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 115</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl>: ni tamen exciderit, id. poët. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omina ni repetant Argis numenque reducant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Boi detrectāssent pugnam, ni fama ... animos fregisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea se dicturum, quae ni fiant, nulla sit pacis condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 33, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 22, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30883.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n30883.10" n="1" level="3"> In formal lang. of law, in agreements, promises, stipulations, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum is sponsionem fecisset ni vir bonus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicem ferre, ni vindicias dederit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum illud quod dicitur sive nive irrident, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:23:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo qui cum habeam judicem, Ni dolo malo instipulatus sis. nive etiam dum siem Quinque et viginti annos natus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3</bibl></cit> (4), 25 (v. the passage <cb n="NICO" /> in connection); so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 9</bibl>: id ni fit, mecum pignus, si quis volt, dato in urnam mulsi, <hi rend="ital">that it is not so, bet me</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 72</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n30883.11" n="2" level="3"> Ni quis scivit (if any one has not voted), <hi rend="ital">the name of a</hi> centuria <hi rend="ital">created by Servius Tullius for those to vote in who had not voted in their own</hi> centuriae, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=177" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 177</bibl> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n30883.12" n="3" level="3"> For nisi quod, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n30883.13" n="4" level="3"> Ni forte, for nisi forte: <cit><quote lang="la">ni forte satius est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:25:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 25, 12</bibl></cit> (Foss, nisi), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nica: <entryFree id="n30884" type="greek" key="ni_ca_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīcā</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">ni/kae, ni/ka</foreign>, <sense id="n30884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conquer!</hi> = vincas, a cry with which each party in the circus encouraged its favorite combatant, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 338, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 573</bibl>, n. 54.</sense></entryFree>
nicaea: <entryFree id="n30885" type="main" key="Ni_caea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcaea</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcēa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 48</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ni/kaia</foreign>. <sense id="n30885.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several cities</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30885.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Bithynia, on Lake Ascanius, formerly called</hi> Antigonia, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Isnik</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Nice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 46, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 49, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 22, 43, § 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30885.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Locris, near Thermopylæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:32" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes">35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30885.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An Indian city on the Hydaspes, founded by Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:23" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:8:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 8, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30885.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Liguria, a colony of Marseilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30885.5" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n30885.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcaeensis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcensis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 48</bibl>), e, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nicene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 12</bibl>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst. plur., the inhabitants of Nicæa</hi>, in Bithynia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n30885.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī-caenus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Nicene</hi>: Nicaena fides, <hi rend="ital">the confession of faith established at the Council of Nice</hi>, Cod. Th. 1, 1, 2.</sense></entryFree>
nicaeus: <entryFree id="n30886" type="gloss" key="Ni_caeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nikai=os</foreign> (who grants victory), <sense id="n30886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of Jupiter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad templum Jovis, quem Nicaeum vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 21, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nicander: <entryFree id="n30887" type="main" key="Ni_cander"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcander</orth>, <itype>dri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ni/kandros</foreign>. <sense id="n30887.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A physician, poet, and grammarian of Colophon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30887.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Ver. 274, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicanor: <entryFree id="n30888" type="main" key="Ni_ca_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcānor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nika/nwr</foreign>. <sense id="n30888.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A grammarian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30888.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A ceiebrated painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 39, § 122</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30888.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 26, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicarchus: <entryFree id="n30889" type="gloss" key="Ni_carchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ni/karxos</foreign>, <sense id="n30889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 650, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicarium: <entryFree id="n30890" type="gloss" key="Ni_ca^rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcărium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nika/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n30890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Maff.</author> Mus. Ver. 133, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicator: <entryFree id="n30891" type="main" key="Ni_ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcātor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nikh/twr</foreign> (victor). <sense id="n30891.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An epithet given to the members of King Perseus's body-guard</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors regia, quos Nicatoras appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 19, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30891.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of the Seleucidæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 11, 12, § 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicea: <entryFree id="n30892" type="main" key="Ni_ce_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Nicaea.</entryFree>
nicephorium: <entryFree id="n30893" type="main" key="Ni_ce_pho^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcēphŏrĭum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcēphŏrĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nikhfo/rion</foreign>. <sense id="n30893.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A grove near Pergamum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 33</bibl> and 34.—</sense><sense id="n30893.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Mesopotamia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:86 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 21, § 86 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
nicephorius: <entryFree id="n30894" type="main" key="Ni_ce_pho^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcēphŏrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcēphŏrĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 129</bibl>). <sense id="n30894.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The bringer of victory</hi>, a surname of Jupiter, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30894.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Armenia, near Tigranocerta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicephorus: <entryFree id="n30895" type="main" key="Ni_ce_pho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcēphŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nikhfo/ros</foreign> (who brings victory), <sense id="n30895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 2, § 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 83, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicer: <entryFree id="n30896" type="main" key="Ni_cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcer</orth>, <itype>cri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the river Neckar</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. Const. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 423</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> 7, 324</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
niceros: <entryFree id="n30897" type="main" key="Ni_ce^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcĕros</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nike/rws</foreign>, <sense id="n30897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a perfumer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:65:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 65, 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30897.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcĕrō-tĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Niceros</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:38:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 38, 8</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:55:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 55, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 324</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
niceterium: <entryFree id="n30898" type="greek" key="ni_ce_te_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīcētērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nikhth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n30898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the prize of victory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:68" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicetianus: <entryFree id="n30899" type="main" key="Ni_ce_ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcētĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n30899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Nicetius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nicias: <entryFree id="n30900" type="main" key="Ni_ci^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*niki/as</foreign>. <sense id="n30900.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Athenian statesman and general, who fell in the expedition against Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30900.1" n="II" level="1"> Nicias Curtius, <hi rend="ital">a grammarian, a companion of Cicero in Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 28, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nico: <entryFree id="n30901" type="main" key="ni^co1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭco</orth>, <itype>ci, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root gnic-, gnig-; Germ. neigen; cf. conivere (for cognigvere), to close (the eyelids), shut fast; v. also nitor, nixus</etym>, <sense id="n30901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to beckon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 63</bibl> and 64.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30902" type="main" key="Ni_co2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcon</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 656, 5</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ni/kwn</foreign>. <sense id="n30902.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A physician</hi>, Cic. <pb n="1206" /> <cb n="NIDO" /> Fam. 7, 20, 3.—</sense><sense id="n30902.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A famous pirate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:30:section=79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 30, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicocles: <entryFree id="n30903" type="main" key="Ni_cocles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcocles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nikoklh=s</foreign>, <sense id="n30903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tyrant of Sicyon, overthrown by Aratus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicolaus: <entryFree id="n30904" type="main" key="Ni_co^la_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcŏlāus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*niko/laos</foreign>, <sense id="n30904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Peripatetic philosopher from Damascus, a friend of Augustus;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcolāus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Nicolaus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dactyli Nicolai,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of dates of a larger size than ordinary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 45</bibl></cit>; Edict. Diocl. p. 18.</sense></entryFree>
nicomedenses: <entryFree id="n30905" type="main" key="Ni_co^me_denses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcŏmēdenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. Nicomedia, II.</entryFree>
nicomedes: <entryFree id="n30906" type="main" key="Ni_co^me_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcŏmēdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nikomh/dhs</foreign>. <sense id="n30906.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Prusias, a king of Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:61:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 61, 229</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 63</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30906.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The son of the former, who declared himself a freedman of the Roman people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:5" default="NO">38, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicomedia: <entryFree id="n30907" type="main" key="Ni_co^me_di_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcŏmēdīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nikomh/deia</foreign>, <sense id="n30907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital of Bithynia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Izmid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39:45" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 39, 45</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30907.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcŏmēdenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Nicomedians</hi>, Plin. et Traj. Ep. 37 (46), 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:9:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 389, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicon: <entryFree id="n30908" type="main" key="Ni_con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. 2. Nico.</entryFree>
nicophoros: <entryFree id="n30909" type="greek" key="ni_co^pho^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīcŏphŏros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">niko/foros</foreign>, <sense id="n30909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bind-weed, withwind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milax quoque, qui et nicophoros nominatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 49, § 82</bibl></cit> (Jahn, anthophoros).</sense></entryFree>
nicopolis: <entryFree id="n30910" type="main" key="Ni_co^po^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcŏpŏlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*niko/polis</foreign>, <sense id="n30910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities</hi>, among them <hi rend="ital">a city of Epirus, founded by Augustus to commemorate the battle of Actium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Prevesa Vecchia</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Paleo-prevesa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">a city in Lesser Armenia, built by Pompey</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 36.</sense></entryFree>
nicopolitanus: <entryFree id="n30911" type="main" key="Ni_co^po^li_ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcŏpŏlītānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n30911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Nicopolis, Nicopolitan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīcŏpŏlītāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Nicopolitans</hi>, in Lower Moesia, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 527, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nictatio: <entryFree id="n30912" type="hapax" key="nicta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nictātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nicto</etym>, <sense id="n30912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a winking</hi> with the eyes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 57, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nicto: <entryFree id="n30913" type="main" key="nicto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nicto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1, and ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nictor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype>, <sense id="n30913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [1. nico], <hi rend="ital">to move the eyelids</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30913.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to move the eyelids up and down, to wink, blink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerisque naturale ut nictari (al. nictare) non cessent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 54, § 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:156" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 57, § 156</bibl>.—Form nicto, ĕre: (canis) voce suā nictit ululatque ibi acute, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=177" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 177</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 346 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n30913.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make a sign with the eyes, to wink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque illa ulli homini nutet, nictet, annuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 72</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30913.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of fire: <cit><quote lang="la">nictantia fulgura flammae,</quote> <trans><tr>flashing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30913.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to exert one's self, to strive</hi>: nictare et oculorum et aliorum membrorum nisu saepe aliquid conari, dictum est ab antiquis, ut Lucretius in libro quarto (6, 836): Hic ubi nictari nequeunt (Lachm. nixari): Caecilius in Hymnide: Garrulis medentes jactent, sine nictentur perticis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=177" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 177</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
nictus: <entryFree id="n30914" type="main" key="nictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nictus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. nico</etym>, <sense id="n30914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a winking, blinking</hi> with the eyes, Caecil. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=177" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 177</bibl> Müll. (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 460</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 138</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:418" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 418</bibl>, the correct read. is nutu).</sense></entryFree>
nidamentum: <entryFree id="n30915" type="main" key="ni_da_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīdāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nidus</etym>. * <sense id="n30915.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The materials for a nest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nervum ille hodie nidamenta congeret,</quote> <trans><tr>he will scrape together a nest to get himself a drubbing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 51</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n30915.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a nest.</hi> blattas nidamenta ponere, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 202</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nidicus: <entryFree id="n30916" type="hapax" key="ni_di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a nest</hi>: usque ad limina nidica esca vilis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 336, 10</bibl> dub. (a corrupt passage).</sense></entryFree>
nidificium: <entryFree id="n30917" type="hapax" key="ni_di^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīdĭfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nidifico</etym>, <sense id="n30917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 211, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nidifico: <entryFree id="n30918" type="main" key="ni_di^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīdĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>nidus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n30918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to build a nest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidificant aves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:3" default="NO">8, 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola piscium nidificat ex algā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 26, 42, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turdi luto nidificantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 147</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: sic vos non vobis nidificatis aves, Verg. ap. Don. Vit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nidificus: <entryFree id="n30919" type="hapax" key="ni_di^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīdĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nidus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n30919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nest-making</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <trans><tr>when birds make their nests</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 714" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 714</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nidipantis: <entryFree id="n30920" type="hapax" key="nidipantis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nidipantis</orth>, <itype>a mutilated epithet of cassia</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 13</bibl>.</entryFree>
nidor: <entryFree id="n30921" type="main" key="ni_dor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīdor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kni/ssa</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">knidia</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n30921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vapor, steam, smell</hi>, from any thing <cb n="NIGE" /> boiled, roasted, burned, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nidoris odores, Lucr 6, 987: galbaneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguescant madidi laeto nidore Penates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:27:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 27, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 85, § 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnumque recens exstinctum lumen ubi acri Nidore offendit nares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ganearum nidor atque fumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus quidam nidor ex adustā plumā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">captus nidore culinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:162" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidor e culinā, said of a slave who hangs constantly about the kitchen,</quote> <trans><tr>a fume of the kitchen, kitchen-companion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nidoro: <entryFree id="n30922" type="gloss" key="ni_do_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīdōro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n30922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to give out steam, to steam</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 167</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nidorosus: <entryFree id="n30923" type="hapax" key="ni_do_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīdōrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nidor</etym>, <sense id="n30923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">steaming, reeking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">holocaustomata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
nidulor: <entryFree id="n30924" type="main" key="ni_du^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīdŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n30924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [nidus]. </sense><sense id="n30924.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to build a nest</hi>: halcyones hieme in aquā nidulantur, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 145, 7</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:4" default="NO">2, 29, 4</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n30924.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to make a nest for one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra rigorem hiemis vermiculos fetus sui nidulantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 98</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nidulus: <entryFree id="n30925" type="main" key="ni_du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīdŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little nest.</hi> </sense><sense id="n30925.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ithacam illam, in asperrimis saxulis, tamquam nidulum, affixam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 196</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29, 2</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n30925.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a place of retirement</hi>: senectutis, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opuscula mea, quia plurima evolaverunt de nidulo suo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 47, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nidus: <entryFree id="n30926" type="main" key="ni_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindred with Sanscr. nīda and the Germ. and Engl. nest</etym>, <sense id="n30926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nest.</hi> </sense><sense id="n30926.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingere et construere nidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tignis nidum suspendit hirundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 307</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">struere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">confingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 33, 49, § 93</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, of a single nest: <cit><quote lang="la">propria cum jam facit arbore nidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 80</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores pennas nido extendere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to raise one's self above one's birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30926.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30926.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The young birds in a nest</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nidi loquaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 475</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidi queruli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 148" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30926.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30926.5" n="(a)" level="5"> Of three children at a birth: <cit><quote lang="la">loquax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30926.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A litter of pigs in a sty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30926.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A receptacle, case</hi>, for books or goods, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:118:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 118, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:17:5" default="NO">7, 17, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30926.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A dwelling, residence, house, home</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu nidum servas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsae Acherontiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 196</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">senectae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequitiae nidum fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:Sent. v. 10" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> Sent. v. 10</bibl></cit> Rib.—</sense><sense id="n30926.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A vessel in the shape of a nest, a bowl, goblet</hi>: nidus potilis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 145, 3</bibl> (Sat. Men. 77, 8).</sense></entryFree>
nigellio: <entryFree id="n30927" type="gloss" key="Ni^gelli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭgellĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nigellus, swarthy</etym>, <sense id="n30927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> 310, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nigellus: <entryFree id="n30928" type="main" key="ni^gellus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭgellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n30928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. niger], <hi rend="ital">somewhat black, dark</hi> (ante-class.): oculi suppaetuli nigellis pupulis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 456, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amiculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 550, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cadmi nigellae filiae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the letters of the alphabet</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30929" type="main" key="Ni^gellus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭgellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 226, 8</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭgella</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 4</bibl>, n. 20.</sense></entryFree>
niger: <entryFree id="n30930" type="main" key="ni^ger1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭger</orth>, <itype>gra, grum</itype> (<sense id="n30930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. fem.</hi> nigraï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 537</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> nigrior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 7</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">adj., black, sable, dark, dusky</hi> (cf.: ater, pullus). </sense><sense id="n30930.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae alba sint, quae nigra, dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamvis ille niger, quamvis tu candidus esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hederae nigrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae (= umbrosae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 21, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:295" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 295</bibl></cit> (for which atrum nemus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 165</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">caelum pice nigrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigerrimus Auster,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>causing darkness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 278</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigros efferre maritos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>killed by poison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:71" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula nigra,</quote> <trans><tr>poisoned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20:68" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20, 68</bibl></cit> (3, 23, 10).—Prov.: facere candida de nigris; <cit><quote lang="la">nigra in candida vertere,</quote> <trans><tr>to turn black into white</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 315</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭgrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a black spot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 291</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30930.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30930.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrorumque memor, dum licet, ignium (= lugubris rogi),</quote> <trans><tr>of the funeral pile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>the day of death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 19, 19: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter niger,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pluto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1705" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1705</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30930.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sad, mournful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:18" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:404" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 404</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30930.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unlucky, ill-omened</hi>: huncine solem<cb n="NIGR" />  Tam nigrum surrexe mihi? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:21:38" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 21, 38</bibl> (3, 25, 4): lapis, <hi rend="ital">the spot in the Comitium where Romulus or one of his adherents was slain</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=177" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 177</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n30930.6" n="D" level="2"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">black, bad, wicked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phormio, nec minus niger, nec minus confidens, quam ille Terentianus est Phormio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic niger est, hunc tu, Romane, caveto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 85</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30931" type="main" key="Ni^ger2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭger</orth>, <itype>gri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aquilius Niger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30932" type="main" key="Ni^ger3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭger</orth>, <itype>gris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Africa</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 673</bibl>; v. Nigris.</sense></entryFree>
nigidius: <entryFree id="n30933" type="main" key="Ni^gi^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭgĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <sense id="n30933.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">P. Nigidius Figulus,</quote> <trans><tr>a celebrated Roman scholar, a contemporary of Cicero and Cæsar, the composer of several grammatical works</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl> sqq.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30933.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭgĭdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Nigidius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:4:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:14:3" default="NO">19, 14, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nigina: <entryFree id="n30934" type="spur" key="ni_gi_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīgīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, a false read. for nyma. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 82, § 82</bibl>.</entryFree>
nigir: <entryFree id="n30935" type="main" key="Nigir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nigir</orth>, v. Nigris.</entryFree>
nigrans: <entryFree id="n30936" type="main" key="ni_^grans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. nigro <sense id="n30936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nigredo: <entryFree id="n30937" type="main" key="ni_^gre_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grēdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>niger</etym>, <sense id="n30937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blackness, black color</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">capilli corvinā nigredine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 118, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigredo ollae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,042:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Nah. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 137</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrae noctis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, § 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nigrefacio: <entryFree id="n30938" type="gloss" key="ni_^grefaci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grefacĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. niger-facio</etym>, <sense id="n30938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make black, to blacken</hi>: nigrefacio, <foreign lang="greek">melanopoiw=</foreign>, Vet. Gloss.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nigrĕfīo</orth>, <hi rend="ital">to become black</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nigreo: <entryFree id="n30939" type="main" key="ni_^gre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>1. niger</etym>, <sense id="n30939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be black</hi> (ante-class.): solis occasu nigret, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 144, 11</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 88 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">nimbis nigret, opp. splendet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 13" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit> (Trag. Rel. v. 260 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
nigresco: <entryFree id="n30940" type="main" key="ni_^gresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^gresco</orth>, <itype>grŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n30940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> (usu. ī) [id.], <hi rend="ital">to become black, grow dark</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">latices nigrescere sacros, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebris nigrescere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 824</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrescunt sanguine venae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baca incipiens nigrescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrescens cutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 5, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrescentes dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacae cum jam nigruerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:48" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies nigrescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 30, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nigrianus: <entryFree id="n30941" type="main" key="Ni_^gri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī^grĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n30941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to M. Pescennius Niger, the rival of Septimius Severus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Scap. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nigricans: <entryFree id="n30942" type="main" key="ni_^gri^cans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. nigrico <sense id="n30942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nigrico: <entryFree id="n30943" type="main" key="ni_^gri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>1. niger</etym>, <sense id="n30943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be blackish</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">epimelas fit, cum in candidā gemmā superne nigricat colos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:10:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 128</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭgrĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., blackish, swarthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrius color nigricans aspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 135</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:193" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 26, 66, § 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nigricolor: <entryFree id="n30944" type="hapax" key="ni_^gri^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grĭcŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. niger-color</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">mela/gxroos</foreign>, <sense id="n30944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a black color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nigriculus: <entryFree id="n30945" type="main" key="ni_^gri^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym><lbl>dim.</lbl> of niger</etym>, <sense id="n30945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blackish, dark, swarthy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:40:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, 40, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nigridius: <entryFree id="n30946" type="gloss" key="ni_^gridi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^gridĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. niger</etym>, <sense id="n30946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blackish</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nigrifico: <entryFree id="n30947" type="hapax" key="ni_^gri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. niger-facio</etym>, <sense id="n30947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make black, to blacken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nigrinus: <entryFree id="n30948" type="main" key="Ni_^gri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī^grīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī^grīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. niger, swarthy</etym>, <sense id="n30948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C Pontius Nigrinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 73</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nigrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:75" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 430, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nigris: <entryFree id="n30949" type="main" key="Ni_^gris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī^gris</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī^gir</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī^-ger</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 673</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in the interior of Africa</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Joliba</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Niger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 21, 32, § 77</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī^grītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people living near the Niger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:10:4" default="NO">3, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nigritia: <entryFree id="n30950" type="main" key="ni_^gri^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grĭtĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. niger</etym>, <sense id="n30950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">black color, blackness</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 34, § 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:134" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 38, 62, § 134</bibl>. —Form nigrities, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:20:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 20, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
nigritudo: <entryFree id="n30951" type="hapax" key="ni_^gri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n30951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">black color, blackness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 36, 52, § 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nigro: <entryFree id="n30952" type="main" key="ni_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n30952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n30952.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be black</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae nigrant nigro de semine nata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 733</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30952.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to make black, to blacken</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30952.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mgrāsset sibi planctu lacertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:83" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30952.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make dark, to darken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrati ignorantiae tenebris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^grans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., black, dark-colored, dusky</hi>: nigrantia boum cornua,<pb n="1207" /> <cb n="NIHI" />  Varr R. R. 2, 5: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrantes terga juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrantes alae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrantes domos ammarum intrāsse silentūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12, 33</bibl></cit> (4, 11, 33): <cit><quote lang="la">nigrante profundo,</quote> <trans><tr>the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:258" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:697" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that produces clouds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 353</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nigror: <entryFree id="n30953" type="main" key="ni_^gror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^gror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. niger</etym>, <sense id="n30953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blackness</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): noctis, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 515, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrorem in ulceribus excitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubidus est rufus, atrore et nigrore multo mixtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nihil: <entryFree id="n30954" type="main" key="ni^hil"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhil</orth>, <itype>or</itype> (ante-class. and post-Aug.) contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">nīl</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n30954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indecl.;</hi> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhĭlum</orth>, or contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">nīlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ne-hilum, not the least; v. hilum</etym>. </sense><sense id="n30954.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhil</orth>, <hi rend="ital">nothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est agriculturā melius, nihil uberius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de re publicā nihil loquebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Nihil agere, <hi rend="ital">to accomplish nothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil agis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil agis dolor! quamvis sis molestus, numquam te esse confitebor malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ergo agebat Q. Maximus? nihil L. Paulus? ceteri senes nihil agebant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 809</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:66:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 66, 3</bibl>.—In like manner, nihil per aliquem (sc. agere): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil per Senatum, multa et magna per populum et absente populo et invito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">victor, quo nihil erat moderatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita tibi persuadeas, mihi te carius nihil fuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam miserabile, quam ex beato miser,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 17, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.4" n="(d)" level="5"> Nihil, nec. . nec (without destroying the negation): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil me nec subterfugere voluisse reticendo, nec obscurare dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; v. neque.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Nihil non, <hi rend="ital">everything</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil non ad rationem dirigebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 37, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil non arroget armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 19, 3</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Non nihil and haud nihil, <hi rend="ital">something, somewhat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nihil, ut in tantis malis, est profectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nihil me consolatur, cum recordor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud nihil,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud nihil ambigam,</quote> <trans><tr>I may be somewhat in doubt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Nihil quidquam or nihil unum, <hi rend="ital">nothing whatever, nothing at all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil ego tibi hodie consili quicquam dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine studio nihil quidquam egregium nemo umquam assequetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:30:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 30, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodiis ut nihil unum insigne, ita omnis generis dona dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil aliud,</quote> <trans><tr>if there were nothing else</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 19, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 35, 8</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil novi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil humanarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,018:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. Quir. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est lucri quod me hodie facere mavelim, quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—Adjectives also, of the second declension as well as of the third, are not unfrequently joined to nihil in the same case, as nihil honestum, lautum, forte, illustre: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil exspectatione vestrā dignum dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 137</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">i</foreign>) Nihil, or mhil aliud, with nisi, quam, praeter, praeterquam, etc., <hi rend="ital">nothing else than, nothing except, nothing but</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, quantus quantus, nihil nisi sapientia es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare nihil aliud est, nisi eum ipsum diligere, quem ames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil aliud fecerunt, nisi rem detulerunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:37:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil aliud, quam de hoste cogitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tibi deest praeter voluntatem,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing except</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puto te existimare, me ex his miseriis nihil aliud quaerere, nisi ut homines intellegant, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nihil praeterquam de vitā cogitarent, Auct. B. Alex. 8.—Sometimes, in this connection, elliptically: Herdonius, si nihil aliud, hostem se fatendo prope denuntiavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil aliud, vulneribus certe ferrum hostile hebetarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illā quidem nocte nihil praeterquam vigilatum est in urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl>.—Hence, as <pos>adv.</pos>: nihil aliud quam, <hi rend="ital">only</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil aliud quam prendere prohibito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is intromissus in castra nihil aliud quam hoc narrāsse fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:32:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 32, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil aliud quam in populationibus res fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:49:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 49, 9 al.</bibl></cit>—（<foreign lang="greek">k</foreign>) Nihil ... quin or quominus, <hi rend="ital">nothing whereby</hi>: nihil praetermisi ... quin Pompeium a Caesaris conjunctione avocarem, <hi rend="ital">I have omitted</hi> <cb n="NIHI" /> <hi rend="ital">nothing that might separate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil moror, quominus decemviratu abeam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil facere oportet, quominus excedat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 27, 4</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">l</foreign>) Nihil est quod, cur, quamobrem, etc., <hi rend="ital">there is no reason why I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">you</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">need not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est jam, quod tu mihi succenseas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est, quod adventum nostrum extimescas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ego nunc nil est, cur me morer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est, cur advenientibus te offerre gestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil excogitem, quamobrem Oppianico damnari necesse sit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 70</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">m</foreign>) Nihil est, ut, <hi rend="ital">there is nothing that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil fuit in Catulis, ut eos exquisito judicio putares uti litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 133</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">n</foreign>) Nihil est, <hi rend="ital">it is of no use, to no purpose, in vain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at ego ab hac puerum reposcam, ne mox infitias eat. Nihil est. Nam ipsa haec ultro, ut factum est, fecit omnem rem palam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: at nihil est, ignotum ad illum mittere: operam luseris. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 6</bibl>.—In a question: <cit><quote lang="la">usque adeo nihil est, quod nostra infantia caelum hausit Aventini?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:84" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 84</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">o</foreign>) Nihil ad me (sc. pertinet): <cit><quote lang="la">recte an secus, nihil ad nos: aut si ad nos, nihil ad hoc tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 28, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 16</bibl>; also, nihil ad, <hi rend="ital">nothing to, nothing in comparison with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ad Persium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 25</bibl></cit>;
