<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil ad tuum equitatum, Caesar, sed ex eis, quos habuit, electos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 8, 24</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">p</foreign>) Nihil minus, <hi rend="ital">nothing less so</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">by no means, not at all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadit ergo in virum bonum mentiri, fallere? nihil minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:20:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 20, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an Gallos existimatis hic versari animo demisso atque humili? nihil vero minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 11, 23</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">r</foreign>) Nihil dum, <hi rend="ital">nothing as yet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam nihil dum audieramus, nec ubi esses, nec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 12, 4</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">s</foreign>) Nihil mihi cum illo est, <hi rend="ital">I have nothing to do with him</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum nihil rei nobis Demipho est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F 2, 308</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">t</foreign>) Nihil esse, <hi rend="ital">to be nothing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nobody, to have no power, to be of no use</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nihil putare,</quote> <trans><tr>to esteem meanly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:53:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 53, 114</bibl></cit> (B. and K. nihili): <cit><quote lang="la">accepimus eum nihil hominis esse,</quote> <trans><tr>a worthless fellow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:32:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 32, 77</bibl></cit>; but de Attio Dionysio nihil puto esse, <hi rend="ital">nothing about him</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">no news of him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 5</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">u</foreign>) Aut nihil aut paulum, <hi rend="ital">little</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nothing</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o)li/gon h) ou)de/n</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">aut nihil aut paulo cui tum concedere digna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 131</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30954.5" n="B" level="2"> Adverb. </sense><sense id="n30954.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Not</hi> (as a strengthened non), <hi rend="ital">in nothing, in no respect, not at all</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me nihil poenitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjecturā nihil opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:37:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficio isto legis nihil utitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de fratre nihil ego te accusavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebani nihil moti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 38</bibl>; 49; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 16, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil miror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:38" default="NO">6, 1, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To no purpose, in vain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herele hanc quidem Nihil tu amassis: mihi haec desponsa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">For no reason</hi>: quorsum tandem aut cur ista quaeris? <hi rend="ital">M</hi> Nihil sane, nisi ne nimis diligenter anquiras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n30954.9" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhĭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (contr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">nīlum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 67</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">nothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erit aliquid, quod aut ex nihilo oriatur, aut in nihilum subito occidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de nihilo quippiam fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:9:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interire in nihilum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venire ad nihilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad nihilum recidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: quam mihi ista pro nihilol <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid pro nihilo putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 7, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:16:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 16, § 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Nihili, <hi rend="ital">of no value, worthless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem putamus esse non hili, dicimus nihili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 81</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: nihili, qui nec hili quidem est. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=175" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 175</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">unde is nihili? ubi fuisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: nihili est autem suum Qui officium facere immemor est. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nihili factus,</quote> <trans><tr>unmanned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, nihili pendere or facere, <hi rend="ital">to esteem as nothing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.11" n="(g)" level="5"> De nihilo, <hi rend="ital">for nothing, without cause</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reason</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mali rem exempli esse, de nihilo hospites corripi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:29" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.12" n="(d)" level="5"> Nihilo, with <hi rend="ital">compp., by nothing, no</hi>: nihilo pluris, quam si, etc., <hi rend="ital">no more than if</hi>, etc., Plaut. Bacch. <cb n="NILU" /> 3, 4, 21: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Men. 5:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaedriae esse nilo minus amicum quam Antiphoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit> (but minus nihilo, <hi rend="ital">less than nothing</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 2</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo benevolentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo major,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo tamen setius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 4</bibl></cit> and 7: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil segnius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 38</bibl></cit>.—Esp. as <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhĭlō mĭnus</orth>, <itype>or, in one word</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhĭlōmĭnus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">none the less, no less, nevertheless, notwith standing</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30954.13" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">minus dolendum fuit re non perfectā, sed puniendum certe nihilo minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 9, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.14" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">si, etsi, quamvis, quamquam, ut</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">in iis rebus, quae nihilo minus, ut ego absim, confici possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo minus eloquentiae studendum est, etsi ea quidam perverse abutuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia sunt, quae quamvis nolit accidere, nihilominus laudat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:44" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil fiet, nihilominus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 39, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n30954.15" n="3" level="3"> Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">tamen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilominus ego hoc faciam tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Nihilo aliter, <hi rend="ital">no otherwise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego isti nihilo sum aliter ac fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, adverb., for non, <hi rend="ital">not, by no means</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilum metuenda timere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 53</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30954.17" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nīl</orth>, <hi rend="ital">nothing, no</hi> (rare and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">in Cic. not at all): nil intra est oleam, nil extra est in nuce durum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 4, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil sanguinis,</quote> <trans><tr>no drop of blood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil sui,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing proper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:435" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 435</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 10, 2</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 29</bibl>, the true reading is nihil): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ridere meum, tam nil, nulla tibi vendo Iliade,</quote> <trans><tr>such a trifle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:122" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.18" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> as <hi rend="ital">adv., not at all, by no means</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil opus est verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nil umor abundet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 265</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:266" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 266</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil pictis timidus navita puppibus Fidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30954.19" n="IV" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nīlum</orth>, <case>abl.</case> nīlo, <hi rend="ital">nothing</hi> (Lucretian): <cit><quote lang="la">ad nilum revorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 237</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 673</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:791" default="NO" valid="yes">791</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:797" default="NO" valid="yes">797</bibl>; 2, 756; <cit><quote lang="la">864: nil igitur fieri de nilo posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 205</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:266" default="NO" valid="yes">266</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nihildum: <entryFree id="n30955" type="main" key="ni^hildum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhildum</orth>, v. nihil, I. <foreign lang="greek">r</foreign>.</entryFree>
nihili: <entryFree id="n30956" type="main" key="ni^hi^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhĭli</orth>, <itype>v nihil</itype>, II. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</entryFree>
nihilo: <entryFree id="n30957" type="main" key="ni^hi^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhĭlo</orth>, v. nihil, II. <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n30958" type="gloss" key="ni^hi^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhĭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nihil</etym>, <sense id="n30958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a good-fornothing fellow</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">ou)damino/s</foreign>, nihilo, nugatori. us, gerra, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
nihilominus: <entryFree id="n30959" type="main" key="ni^hi^lo_mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhĭlōmĭnus</orth>, v. nihil, II. <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>.</entryFree>
nihilum: <entryFree id="n30960" type="main" key="ni^hi^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭhĭlum</orth>, v. nihil, II.</entryFree>
nil: <entryFree id="n30961" type="main" key="ni_l"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīl</orth>, v. nihil, III.</entryFree>
nileus: <entryFree id="n30962" type="main" key="Ni_leus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīleus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the enemies of Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
niliacus: <entryFree id="n30963" type="main" key="Ni_li^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīlĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Nilus, II.</entryFree>
nilicola: <entryFree id="n30964" type="main" key="Ni_li^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīlĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Nilus, II. B.</entryFree>
nilideslacus: <entryFree id="n30965" type="main" key="Ni_lides la^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīlides lăcus</orth>, <sense id="n30965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake in Lower Mauritania</hi> lacus stagnans quem vocant Niliden, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 676</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
niligena: <entryFree id="n30966" type="main" key="Ni_li^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīlĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, v. Nilus, II. C.</entryFree>
nilios: <entryFree id="n30967" type="greek" key="ni_li^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīlĭos</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">nei/lios</foreign>, <sense id="n30967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone, of the color of a dark topaz</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 35, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
niloticus: <entryFree id="n30968" type="main" key="Ni_lo_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīlōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Nilus, II. D.</entryFree>
nilotis: <entryFree id="n30969" type="main" key="Ni_lo_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīlōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. Nilus, II. E.</entryFree>
nilum: <entryFree id="n30970" type="main" key="ni_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīlum</orth>, v. nihil, IV</entryFree>
nilus: <entryFree id="n30971" type="main" key="Ni_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nei=los</foreign>. <sense id="n30971.0" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The river Nile, celebrated for its annual overflow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:712 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 712 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 10, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:167" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 8, 47, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 676</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 199</bibl> et saep.—It flows through seven mouths into the sea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 26</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 422</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30971.1" n="2" level="3"> Also personified, <hi rend="ital">the god of the Nile, Nilus, father of the Egyptian Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 23, 58</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n30971.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a canal, conduit, aqueduct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscina et nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ductus vero aquarum, quos isti nilos et euripos vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30971.3" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī-lĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Nile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gurges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:1023" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 1023</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera,</quote> <trans><tr>the crocodile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:65:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 65, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">crocodilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 93, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">holus,</quote> <trans><tr>the colocasia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:57:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 57, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30971.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Egyptian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Niliacis carmina lusa modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 318</bibl></cit>: amor, <hi rend="ital">an Egyptian amour</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">with Cleopatra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Apis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:478" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 478</bibl></cit>: juvenca, <hi rend="ital">Io</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Isis.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:81:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 81, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:9:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30971.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīlĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dweller on the Nile, an Egyptian</hi>, Prud. ap. <pb n="1208" /> <cb n="NIMI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:439" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 439</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30971.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīlĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">comm., one born on the banks of the Nile, an Egyptian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, 37</bibl>: Niligenūm deūm, v. l. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 698</bibl> (cf. Lachm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 440</bibl>). —</sense><sense id="n30971.7" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīlōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of the Nile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilotica tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:80:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 80, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30971.8" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīlō-tis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from the Nile, Egyptian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilotis acus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:6:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nimbatus: <entryFree id="n30972" type="hapax" key="nimba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nimbātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nimbus</etym>, perh. <sense id="n30972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">light, trifling, frivolous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis aspecto, tam magis est nimbata et nugae merae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nimbifer: <entryFree id="n30973" type="main" key="nimbi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nimbĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nimbusfero</etym>, <sense id="n30973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">storm-bringing, stormy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter nimbiferas nubes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 858</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 60</bibl></cit> (al. nubifer).</sense></entryFree>
nimbosus: <entryFree id="n30974" type="main" key="nimbo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nimbōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nimbus</etym>, <sense id="n30974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of storms, stormy, rainy</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubilus, nebulosus): fluctu nimbosus Orion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bruma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:89" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:87" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs, i. e. Rome,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 8, § 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nimbus: <entryFree id="n30975" type="main" key="nimbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nimbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n30975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> nimbūm, Pac. ap. Trag. Rel. 412 Rib.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. nabhas, cloud, vapor; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ne/fos, nefe/lh</foreign>; cf.: nubes, nebula</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a violent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pouring rain, a rain-storm</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30975.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: terra abit in nimbos imbremque, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=24" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 24</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nubila nimbis aspergunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrere animos fulminibus, tempestatibus, nimbis, nivibus, grandinibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denso regem operuit nimbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum multo stillaret paenula nimbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30975.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n30975.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A black rain-cloud, a thunder-cloud</hi>: noctisque et nimbūm occaecat nigror, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl>, and de Or. 3, 39, 157: <cit><quote lang="la">involvere diem nimbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 198</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 587</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:97" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30975.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A cloud</hi> in general. So the <hi rend="ital">bright cloud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cloudshaped splendor</hi> which enveloped the gods when they appeared on earth: <cit><quote lang="la">proprie nimbus est, qui deorum vel imperantium capita quasi clara nebula ambire fingitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbo succincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbo effulgens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nube candentes umeros amictus Augur Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in eccl. Lat., of <hi rend="ital">a saint's aureole</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 31, 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n30975.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A cloud</hi> of smoke, dust, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">respiciunt atram in nimbo volitare favillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulvae nimbus harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulveris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 176</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30975.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A head-band, frontlet</hi>, worn by females to make the forehead appear small, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 31</bibl> (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 72</bibl>, the correct reading is not nimbis, but limbis; v. limbus).—</sense><sense id="n30975.7" n="3" level="3"> Like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">cloud</hi>, of a multitude of things which spread out like a cloud: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbus peditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 793</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:215" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:776" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 776</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut nimbum glandis et sagittas ingerebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidum saxorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:8:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corycius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of saffron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:39:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Cilices nimbis hic maduere suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Spect. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna nimbis ebria Nicerotianis,</quote> <trans><tr>full of perfumed unguents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:ib. 10:38:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 38, 8</bibl></cit>: purpureus, <hi rend="ital">a great quantity of flowers</hi>, Claud. Nupt. Honor. et Mar. 298.—</sense><sense id="n30975.8" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A vessel with many holes in it, used at public shows and at entertainments for sprinkling liquid perfumes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimbus vitreus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:112" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 112</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>—* </sense><sense id="n30975.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a storm, tempest</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sudden misfortune</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc quidem nimbum cito transisse laetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nimie: <entryFree id="n30976" type="main" key="ni^mi^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nimius <sense id="n30976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
nimietas: <entryFree id="n30977" type="main" key="ni^mi^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nimius</etym>, <sense id="n30977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a too great number</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quantity; a superfluity, redundancy, excess</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prunarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 133, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 133</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
nimio: <entryFree id="n30978" type="main" key="ni^mi^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭō</orth>, v. nimius <sense id="n30978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> II. 2. b.</sense></entryFree>
nimiopere: <entryFree id="n30979" type="main" key="ni^mi^o^pe^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭŏpĕre</orth>, <itype>more correctly separate</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭō ŏpĕre</orth>.</entryFree>
nimirum: <entryFree id="n30980" type="main" key="ni_mi_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīmīrum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ni, i. q. ne mirum, v. ni, I.; lit. not wonderful; cf., less strong than mirum ni; v. ni, III. A. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>; hence</etym>, to introduce an assertion as indisputable, <sense id="n30980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">without doubt, doubtless, indisputably, certainly, surely, truly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimirum homines frigent,</quote> <trans><tr>are certainly received coolly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimirum Themistocles est auctor adhibendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 71</bibl></cit>: non <cb n="NIMI" /> parva res, sed nimirum omnium maxima, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:22:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 22, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nimirum is princeps ex Latinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is est nimirum Soter, qui salutem dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:63:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 63, § 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnia nimirum eidem di dedere,</quote> <trans><tr>truly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimirum haec illa Charybdis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 558</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui placet alterius sua nimirum est odio sors,</quote> <trans><tr>of course</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 11</bibl></cit>.—After a question: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid id ad rem? nimirum, inquit, in eo causa consistit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 25, 79</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30980.1" n="II" level="1"> Freq. in an ironical sense, <hi rend="ital">doubtless, to be sure, forsooth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperienda nimirum nocte janua fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uni nimirum tibi recte semper erunt res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 15, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimirum summi ducis est occidere Galbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nimis: <entryFree id="n30981" type="main" key="ni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmis</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>ni-, ne-, and root ma-, to measure; cf.: metior, mensa, metare, etc.; hence</etym>, <sense id="n30981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">too much, overmuch, excessively, beyond measure</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30981.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chremes nimis graviter cruciat adulescentulum nimisque inhumane,</quote> <trans><tr>too severely ... too inhumanly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nimis valde nec nimis saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu nimis longo satiate ludo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis castus Bellerophon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix heu nimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis dixi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:45" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30981.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis insidiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:170" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec loca lucis habent nimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:115" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30981.3" n="B" level="2"> With a preceding negative, <hi rend="ital">not too much, not very much, not altogether, not very</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philotimi litterae me quidem non nimis, sed eos admodum delectārunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea dicis non nimis deesse nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caecilium non nimis hanc causam severe, non nimis accurate, non nimis diligenter acturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:22:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 22, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud non nimis probo, quod scribis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium non nimis firmum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud nimis amplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30981.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">beyond measure, exceedingly</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nimis velim lapidem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis id genus ego odi male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 16</bibl>.—Also strengthened by <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tandem, very much, in the highest degree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis quam formido, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis tandem contemnor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 2</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid nimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nimium: <entryFree id="n30982" type="main" key="ni^mi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nimius <sense id="n30982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
nimius: <entryFree id="n30983" type="main" key="ni^mi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nimis</etym>, <sense id="n30983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beyond measure, excessive, too great, too much</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30983.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod autem satis est, eo quidquid accesserit nimium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:27:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 27, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem coërcet, ne in omnes partes nimia fundatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimiae celeritates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 36, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimiā pertinaciā atque arrogantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Prometheus Assiduam nimio pectore pavit avem,</quote> <trans><tr>that grew again too fast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30983.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> of thing, <hi rend="ital">excessive, immoderate, intemperate</hi> in any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">fiduciā nimius, Sall. Fragm. ap. Arus. Mess.: rebus secundis nimii,</quote> <trans><tr>too much elated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimius mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30983.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">impotens et nimius animi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:232" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 232</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30983.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">too much, superabundance, excess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediocritatem illam tenebit, quae est inter nimium et parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:670" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auri argentique nimium fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33</bibl></cit> prooem. § 5.—</sense><sense id="n30983.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">too mighty, too powerful</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Pompeium esse nimium jam liberae reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio legatis nimia ac formidolosa erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30983.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">great beyond measure</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">very great, very much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nimiā pulchritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia memoras mira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:64:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 64, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30983.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: nimium boni est, cui nil est [in diem] mali, <hi rend="ital">it is great good fortune</hi> (a transl. of Eurip. Hec. 2: <foreign lang="greek">kei=nos o)lbiw/tatos</foreign>), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 41</bibl> (Trag. v. 237 Vahl.).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30983.8" n="b" level="4"> In the <case>abl.</case>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭo</orth>, adverb., <hi rend="ital">exceedingly, by far, much, very</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio mavolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 90</bibl></cit>.—Esp., with comparatives, = multo: <cit><quote lang="la">scito, nimio celerius venire quod molestum'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 69</bibl></cit> Lorenz ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio nequior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: quia te nimio plus diligo, Anton. <cb n="NINU" /> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8</bibl> A, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">ne doleas plus nimio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio plus quam satis tutum esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio plus quam velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 37, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 33, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimio amplior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. </sense><sense id="n30983.9" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">too much, too</hi> ( = nimis, in all uses, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">nimium parce facere sumptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium dicere, opp. parum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:58:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 58, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium ne crede colori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium multi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:46:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 46, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium gratum ... gratum praeter modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amantes mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem. 7 et saep.— </sense><sense id="n30983.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Non nimium, <hi rend="ital">not very much, not particularly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud non nimium probo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 30, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30983.11" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very much, greatly, exceedingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nimium lepidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium lepida nimisque nitida femina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci nimium mirabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o fortunatos nimium, sua si bona norint, Agricolas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix, heu nimium felix!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:657" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 657</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:25" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 25</bibl>.—In class. prose esp.—</sense><sense id="n30983.12" n="b" level="4"> Nimium quantum, <hi rend="ital">as much as can be, very much indeed, exceedingly, very</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">differt inter honestum et turpe nimium quantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:25:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 25, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sales in dicendo nimium quantum valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille nimium quantum audacter, Oves, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:6:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 6, 9</bibl></cit> (nimium quam, false reading for quae nimium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 70</bibl>. In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 13</bibl>, the better reading is hem quam, v. Ritschl ad h. l.).—</sense><sense id="n30983.13" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭmĭē</orth> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n30983.14" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Too much, excessively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimie aliquid facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arat (frontem rugis) non nimie sed pulchre dictum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30983.15" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">very much, very</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis nimie frigidis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ningit: <entryFree id="n30984" type="main" key="ningit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ningit</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ninguit</orth>, <itype>ēbat, nxit, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ni/fei</foreign>; cf. nix, and v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 250</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n30984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">it snows</hi>. </sense><sense id="n30984.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ningit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:31" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 367</bibl>: cum ninxerit caelestium molem mihi, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 882</bibl> P. (Trag. Rel. v. 101 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n30984.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">totum istud spatium, quā pluitur et ninguitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 340, 39</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n30984.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shower down, scatter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ningunt rosarum Floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 627</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ningo: <entryFree id="n30985" type="main" key="ningo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ningo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">ninguo</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. ningit.</entryFree>
ningor: <entryFree id="n30986" type="hapax" key="ningor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ningor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ningo</etym>, <sense id="n30986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fall of snow</hi>, App. de Mundo, p. 61, 26.</sense></entryFree>
ninguidus: <entryFree id="n30987" type="main" key="ningui^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ninguĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ninguis</etym>, <sense id="n30987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of snow, snowy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boreas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apophth. 729</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30987.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">falling like snow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>manna</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ninguis: <entryFree id="n30988" type="main" key="ninguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ninguis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with nix</etym>, <sense id="n30988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">snow</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">albas descendere ningues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 736</bibl></cit> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:964" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 964</bibl>, the correct read. is nives, v. Lachm. ad h. l.); so according to Lucil. ap. Charis. <hi rend="ital">p.</hi> 71 P.; App. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 724</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
ninguit: <entryFree id="n30989" type="main" key="ninguit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ninguit</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ninguo</orth>, v. ningit.</entryFree>
ningulus: <entryFree id="n30990" type="main" key="ningu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ningŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><lbl>dim.</lbl> of noenus, from ne-oenus for unus</etym>, <sense id="n30990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nobody</hi>: ningulus, nullus, ut Ennius lib. II.: qui ferro minitere atque in te ningulus ..., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=177" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 177</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 133 Vahl.): ningulus, nullus. Marcius vates: ne ningulus mederi queat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=176" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 176</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ninive: <entryFree id="n30991" type="main" key="Ni_^ni_^ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī^nī^vē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n30991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ancient capital of Assyria</hi>, prob. near the mod. <hi rend="ital">Nebbi Yunus</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 16, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 23, 168</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 4, 357</bibl>; also called Ninus or Ninos, v. Ninus.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30991.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī^nĭvītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Nineveh, the Ninevites</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:12:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 12, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30991.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭnĭvī-tĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Ninevite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ninnius: <entryFree id="n30992" type="main" key="Ninnius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ninnius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n30992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a noble Campanian</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8</bibl>.—So, </sense><sense id="n30992.1" n="1" level="3"> L. Ninnius Quadratus, <hi rend="ital">a tribune of the people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 23, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 31, 68</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30992.2" n="2" level="3"> Ninnius Crassus, <hi rend="ital">who translated the Iliad into Latin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 865</bibl> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 475, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ninus: <entryFree id="n30993" type="main" key="Ni_^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī^nus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ninos</foreign>, <sense id="n30993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the son of Belus, the first king of Assyria, husband of Semiramis, and builder of Nineveh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 1, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">busta Nini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 88</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n30993.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name of the city of Nineveh</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 16, § 42</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Ninos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 215</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30993.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another name</hi> <pb n="1209" /> <cb n="NISI" /> <hi rend="ital">of the city of Hierapolis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23, 6, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ninyas: <entryFree id="n30994" type="main" key="Ni^ny^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭnyas</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭnya</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Ninus and Semiramis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:11" default="NO">1, 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nioba: <entryFree id="n30995" type="main" key="Ni^o^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭŏba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭŏbē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nio/bh</foreign>. <sense id="n30995.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The daughter of Tantalus, and wife of Amphion, king of Thebes, whose seven sons and seven daughters were slain by Apollo and Diana, because, on the strength of her numerous progeny, she triumphed over Latona. Niobe herself was changed into a stone, which was transported in a whirlwind to the top of Sipylus, and has ever since remained wet with tears;</hi> form Niobe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:146 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 146 sq.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form Nioba: Nioba fingitur lapidea, propter aeternum credo in luctu silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 63:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 63, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20</bibl> (3, 13), 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 9" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 9</bibl> and 145.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n30995.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭŏbēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Niobe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n30995.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭŏbĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a son of Niobe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 11" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 11</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n30995.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The daughter of Phoroneus, king of Argos, who bore Argus to Jupiter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 145" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 145</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
niphaeus: <entryFree id="n30996" type="main" key="Ni^phaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭphaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n30996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Rutulian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 570</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
niphas: <entryFree id="n30997" type="main" key="Ni^phas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭphas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nifa/s</foreign> (snow-storm), <sense id="n30997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 278, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
niphates: <entryFree id="n30998" type="main" key="Ni^pha_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭphātes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nifa/ths</foreign> <sense id="n30998.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A part of the Mount Taurus range in Armenia</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Ali-Dagh</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:15:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 15, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n30998.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river that rises in the same</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 245</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:409" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 409</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
niphetus: <entryFree id="n30999" type="main" key="Niphe^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Niphĕtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nifeto/s</foreign> (snowstorm), <sense id="n30999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 516</bibl>, n. 243.</sense></entryFree>
nipparene: <entryFree id="n31000" type="main" key="nippare_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nipparēnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of gem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 64, § 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
niptra: <entryFree id="n31001" type="greek" key="Niptra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Niptra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ni/ptra</foreign>, <sense id="n31001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">water for washing</hi>, the title of a tragedy of Pacuvius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:29:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 29, 3</bibl>; v. the fragments in Trag. Rel. p. 90 sq. Rib.</sense></entryFree>
nireus: <entryFree id="n31002" type="main" key="Ni_reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīreus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ni/reus</foreign>, <sense id="n31002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Charopus and Aglaia, the handsomest man among the Greeks before Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 20, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 15, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 16</bibl> (4, 17), 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 113" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 113</bibl> and 270; <bibl default="NO"><author>Dict. Cret.</author> 4, 17</bibl> (cf. Hom. Il. 2, 673).</sense></entryFree>
nis: <entryFree id="n31003" type="gloss" key="nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nis</orth>, <itype>pro nobis</itype>, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. callim, p. 47 Müll.</entryFree>
nisa: <entryFree id="n31004" type="main" key="Ni_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nisaeus: <entryFree id="n31005" type="main" key="Ni_saeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīsaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 3. Nisus, B. 1.</entryFree>
niseis: <entryFree id="n31006" type="main" key="Ni_se_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīsēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, v. 3. Nisus, B. 2.</entryFree>
niseius: <entryFree id="n31007" type="main" key="Ni_se_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīsēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 3. Nisus, B. 3.</entryFree>
nisi: <entryFree id="n31008" type="main" key="ni^si^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭ-sĭ</orth> (archaic forms <orth extent="full" lang="la">nisei</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nise</orth>, <itype>Lex Rubria</itype>, v. Ritschl, Legis Rubriae pars superstes, Bonnae, 1851, and Rhein. Mus. tom. 8, p. 448 sq.), <sense id="n31008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conj., if not, unless</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31008.1" n="I" level="1"> </sense><sense id="n31008.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu malum curas, Utrum crudum an coctum-edim? nisi tu mihi es tutor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nisi esset, certe postea non discessisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:66:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 66, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non posse ejus imperia diutius sustineri, nisi quid in Caesare sit auxilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31008.3" n="B" level="2"> With interrogatives and negatives, usually in a different clause. </sense><sense id="n31008.4" n="1" level="3"> After an interrogative or negative clause, <hi rend="ital">except, save only, only</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis enuntiaret, nisi quibus mandatum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sentio, nisi in bonis, amicitiam esse non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etenim dicere nemo potest, nisi qui prudenter intellegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:6:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est pietas, nisi voluntas grata in parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 33, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">negant enim quem quam esse virum bonum, nisi sapientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31008.5" n="2" level="3"> With a foll. negative: <cit><quote lang="la">sic orator, nisi multitudine audiente, eloquens esse non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Labienus juravit, se, nisi victorem, in castra non reversurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 87</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31008.6" n="3" level="3"> Closely connected with <hi rend="ital">non</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">legationis non nisi condemnato et ejecto eo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:39:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 39, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non nisi aput Germanias adsequi nomen imperatorium posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quem non nisi per Sejanum aditus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 68</bibl></cit>; 14, 63; 15, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 36, 52, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 6, 4</bibl>.—(The passages in which nisi was supposed to stand for nisi non or non nisi have been <cb n="NISU" /> critically amended; v. Hand, Turs. 4, 253; Kritz and Fabri ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 54, 5</bibl>; Drakenb. and Weissenb. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 16, 1</bibl>; Duker ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 12, 18</bibl>.)—</sense><sense id="n31008.7" n="C" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n31008.8" n="1" level="3"> After nihil, nihil aliud, etc., <hi rend="ital">save, but, than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil am plius nisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est quod festines, nisi ut valeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat historia nihil aliud nisi annalium confectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 12, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 13</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:37:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 108</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31008.9" n="2" level="3"> Non aliter nisi, <hi rend="ital">on no other condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aliter neque classem revocaturum neque exercitum reducturum, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 11, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31008.10" n="3" level="3"> Nisi si, <hi rend="ital">except if, unless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi si etiam illuc pervenerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli putare me ad quemquam longiores epistulas scribere, nisi si qui ad me plura scripsit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi vero si quis est qui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31008.11" n="4" level="3"> Nisi ut, <hi rend="ital">except that, unless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque convivia inire ausus est, nisi ut speculatores cum lanceis circumstarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31008.12" n="5" level="3"> Nisi quod, <hi rend="ital">except that which, save only that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam nunc homines nihili faciunt quod licet nisi quod lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Patrone Epicureo mihi omnia sunt communia, nisi quod in philosophiā vehementer ab eo dissentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia me valde delectant, nisi quod me aere circum foraneo obruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>;
