<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:24:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 24, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab negotiis numquam voluptas remorata est, nisi quod de uxore potuit honestius consuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde causa et origo peregrino sacro parum comperi, nisi quod signum ipsum ... docet advectam religionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31008.13" n="6" level="3"> Nisi quia, <hi rend="ital">except because</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">until that</hi> at nesciebam id dicere illam, nisi quia Correxit miles, quod intellexi minus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31008.14" n="II" level="1"> In transitions; also in the combinations nisi vero, nisi forte, nisi tamen, <hi rend="ital">unless perhaps</hi>, etc., mostly ironical (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ei) mh\ a)/ra, ei mh/ ge, e)kto\s ei) mh/</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">nisi unum hoc faciam ut in puteo cenam coquant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte volumus Epicureorum opinionem sequi, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi vero existimatis dementem Africanum fuisse, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: ne requiras; <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte adulescentes pueritiam debent requirere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hostis nullus erat, nisi forte quem vos jussissetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. Zumpt, Gram. § 569.</sense></entryFree>
nisias: <entryFree id="n31009" type="main" key="Ni_si^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīsĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 3. Nisus, B. 4.</entryFree>
nisibis: <entryFree id="n31010" type="main" key="Ni^si^bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭsĭbis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĕsĕbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ni/sibis</foreign>. <sense id="n31010.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Mesopotamia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nisibin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 16, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 8, 27</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31010.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nĭsĭbēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Nisibis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 8, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31010.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Aria</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nisus: <entryFree id="n31011" type="main" key="ni_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from nitor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31012" type="main" key="ni_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nitor</etym>, <sense id="n31012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resting upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against, a pressure; a striving, exertion, labor, effort</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; nixus in good prose, v. h. v.): pedetentim et sedato nisu, <hi rend="ital">a tread, step</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnarum nisus inanis,</quote> <trans><tr>a flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:834" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 834</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">insolitos docuere nisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic dea se primum rapido pulcherrima nisu Sistit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:852" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 852</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat gravis Entellus nisuque immotus eodem, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in the same posture</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 437</bibl></cit>: hunc stirps Oceani maturis nisibus Aethra Edidit, <hi rend="ital">pains, throes, labor</hi> of parturition (v. 2. nixus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:171" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 171</bibl>.—In prose: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam nisus evomentis adjuvaret,</quote> <trans><tr>retchings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti prospectus nisusque per saxa facilius foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 1</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">quae dubia nisu videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 94:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 94, 2</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">non pervenit nisu sed impetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:10" default="NO">1, 12, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31013" type="main" key="Ni_sus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ni=sos</foreign> <sense id="n31013.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Megara, father of Scylla, who, in order to gain the love of Minos, cut off her father's purple hair, on which the safety of his kingdom depended, whereupon Nisus was changed into a sparrow-hawk, and Scylla into the bird ciris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:404 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 404 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 8</bibl> sqq.; v. Scylla.—</sense><sense id="n31013.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n31013.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī-saeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Nisus, Nisæan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vos Nisaei, naufraga monstra, canes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Scylla, the daughter of Phorcus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:500" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 500</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 331</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n31013.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīsēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Nisus, Scylla</hi> (q. v.), confounded with the daughter of Phorcus: <cit><quote lang="la">praeterita cautus Niseide navita gaudet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 737</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31013.4" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nī-sēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Nisus, Nisæan</hi>: per mare caeruleum trahitur <cb n="NITE" /> Niseia virgo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 390</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 35</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n31013.5" n="4" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīsĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Nisæan</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Megarian</hi>: Nisiades matres Nisiadesque nurus, <hi rend="ital">of Megaris, in Sicily</hi> (a colony of Megara, in Greece), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31013.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Hyrtacus and friend of Euryalus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 294</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 176</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
nitalopices: <entryFree id="n31014" type="greek" key="nita^lo_pi^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nitălōpĭces</orth>, <sense id="n31014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> <itype>as</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, perh. <hi rend="ital">Indian foxes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nitedula: <entryFree id="n31015" type="main" key="ni_te_du^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nītēdŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small red mouse, a dormouse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nitedula mus agrestis rubeus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 181</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 47</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 29</bibl>, the common read. is volpecula, but Bentley's conjecture, nitedula, is adopted by Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 204</bibl>, and by Haupt and Müll.; v. Orell. ad loc.).—The contr. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">nītēla</orth>, v. under nitella.</sense></entryFree>
nitefacio: <entryFree id="n31016" type="main" key="ni^te^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>niteofacio</etym>, <sense id="n31016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make shining</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ventus mare crispicans nitefacit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grato crinem nitefactus olivo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 607</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nitela: <entryFree id="n31017" type="main" key="ni^te_la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>niteo</etym>, <sense id="n31017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brightness, splendor</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n31017.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum nitela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31017.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31017.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which shines</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glitters, a glittering particle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitelae pulveris,</quote> <trans><tr>gold-dust</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 23, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31017.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which causes to shine, a polish</hi>: nitelae oris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">tooth-powder</hi>, Cat ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 277, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n31018" type="main" key="ni_te_la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nītēla</orth>, v nitella.</entryFree>
nitella: <entryFree id="n31019" type="main" key="ni_tella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nītella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (contr from nitedula, q. v, sometimes written <orth extent="full" lang="la">nītēla</orth>, but v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1015" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1015</bibl>), <sense id="n31019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small mouse, a dormouse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 37, 8</bibl>; Serv ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nitellinus: <entryFree id="n31020" type="hapax" key="ni_telli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nītellīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nitella</etym>, <sense id="n31020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> nitella or <hi rend="ital">dormouse</hi>: color, <hi rend="ital">the color of a dormouse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 37, 69, § 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nitens: <entryFree id="n31021" type="main" key="ni^tens1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <sense id="n31021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shining, Part.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">P a.</hi>, from niteo; v. niteo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31022" type="main" key="ni_tens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nītens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <sense id="n31022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pressing upon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">against, Part.</hi> from nitor.</sense></entryFree>
nitenter: <entryFree id="n31023" type="main" key="ni^tenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v niteo, <sense id="n31023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
niteo: <entryFree id="n31024" type="main" key="ni^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype> (<sense id="n31024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur</hi> nitentūm, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 523</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. nix</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to shine, look bright, glitter, glisten</hi> (cf., luceo, fulgeo splendeo). </sense><sense id="n31024.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">placatumque nitet diffuso lumine caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna potest solis radiis percussa nitere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 705</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nitent unguentis, fulgent purpurā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversi niteant cum mille colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere nitent terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera nitent usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 8, 51</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:58:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 58, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6:10" default="NO">8, 6, 10</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n31024.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31024.3" n="1" level="3"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">to be sleek, in good condition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at hau pol nitent (oves),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde sic quaeso nites?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 5, 6, § 27</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic nitet ungula mulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:181" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 181</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31024.4" n="2" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to shine, to look bright</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miseri quibus Intentata nites! ( = pulchra et amabilis videris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ore nitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:89:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 89, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitet ante alias regina comesque Pelides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murice tincta Veste nites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:23:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31024.5" n="3" level="3"> Of fields, plants, etc., <hi rend="ital">to look flourishing, thriving, to thrive</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">camposque nitentes Desuper ostentat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tellus nitet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 99</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31024.6" n="4" level="3"> Of a house: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi hoc praecipio ut niteant aedes,</quote> <trans><tr>be in complete order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 281</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31024.7" n="5" level="3"> Of wealth, etc., <hi rend="ital">to flourish, abound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal in pace niteat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ubi magna nitet domino sene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31024.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shine, be brilliant, look</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be beautiful</hi>: ver vide; <cit><quote lang="la">ut tota floret, ut olet, ut nitide nitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illorum, vides, quam niteat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ubi plura nitent in carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia nobilibus oppidis ni tent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 49</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., shining, glittering, glistening, brilliant, bright</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31024.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli malobathro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:543" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucifer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:93" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitentes solis equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:413" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma nitentia ante rem, deformia inter sanguinem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31024.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31024.11" n="a" level="4"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">sleek, fat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitens taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31024.12" n="b" level="4"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">shining, bright, beautiful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor ore floridulo nitens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderio meo nitenti,</quote> <trans><tr>my darling bright</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: nitentior<pb n="1210" /> <cb n="NITI" />  femina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 405</bibl> (Merkel, decentior).—</sense><sense id="n31024.13" n="c" level="4"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">blooming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitentia culta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor laeta et nitens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrio nitentior ostro flos oritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 211</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31024.14" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31024.15" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Illustrious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">recenti gloriā nitens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non patre nitens linguāve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:19" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 19</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31024.16" n="2" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">brilliant, elegant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:238" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 238</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31024.17" n="3" level="3"> Of the mind, <hi rend="ital">bright, clear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte, oro, nitenti Ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:63" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nitesco: <entryFree id="n31025" type="main" key="ni^tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtesco</orth>, <itype>tŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n31025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [niteo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to shine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glitter, to shine, glitter</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n31025.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: caelum nitescere, arbores frondescere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl> (Trag. v. 192 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">exiguo qui stellarum candore nitescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=174" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus Nudatos umeros oleo perfusa nitescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitescente novā lunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:195" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 12, 74, § 195</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex umero Pelopis non nituisset ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:58" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 58</bibl></cit> (64).—</sense><sense id="n31025.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31025.3" n="1" level="3"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">to grow sleek, well-conditioned, fat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta nitescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31025.4" n="2" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to become blooming;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">perf., to be blooming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o pueri, nituistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 128</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31025.5" n="3" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to grow luxuriously, to thrive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 112</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31025.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be formed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cultivated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ingenio, doctrinā, praeceptione natura nitescat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 16, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">To become illustrious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">celebrated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid non cultu nitescit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 58</bibl>; Halm and Ritter, enitesceret).</sense></entryFree>
nitibundus: <entryFree id="n31026" type="main" key="ni_ti^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nītĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nitor</etym>, <sense id="n31026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pressing against, straining, striving</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mentium conspiratu tacito nitibundi,</quote> <trans><tr>relying upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pondus nitibundum,</quote> <trans><tr>oppressive weight, weighty pressure</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 25, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 27, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nitide: <entryFree id="n31027" type="main" key="ni^ti^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nitidus <sense id="n31027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nitiditas: <entryFree id="n31028" type="hapax" key="ni^ti^di^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtĭdĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nitidus</etym>, <sense id="n31028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">splendor, beauty</hi>: formae, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 143, 29</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 254 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
nitidiuscule: <entryFree id="n31029" type="main" key="ni^ti^di^uscu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtĭdĭuscŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nitidiusculus.</entryFree>
nitidiusculus: <entryFree id="n31030" type="main" key="ni^ti^di^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtĭdĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [nitidus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat more shining</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 84</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtĭ-dĭuscŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a little more finely, sprucely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut curer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nitido: <entryFree id="n31031" type="main" key="ni^ti^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtĭdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make bright</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shining, to polish, smooth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n31031.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramenta detersa nitidentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post serraturam, plagam ferramentis acutis nitidemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentissime nitidatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31031.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to wash, bathe</hi>: eunt ad fontem, nitidant corpora, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 144, 16</bibl> (Trag. v 166 Vahl.); <cit><quote lang="la">so mid.: mundule nitidantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 17" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 17</bibl></cit> (Trag. Rel. v. 603 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
nitidulus: <entryFree id="n31032" type="hapax" key="ni^ti^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat spruce, rather trim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidua nitidula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nitidus: <entryFree id="n31033" type="main" key="ni^ti^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>niteo</etym>, <sense id="n31033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shining, glittering, bright, polished, clear</hi> (class.; syn.: splendidus, lautus). </sense><sense id="n31033.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">facite, sultis, nitidae ut aedes meae sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in picturis alios horrida, inculta ... contra alios nitida, laeta delectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidus juventā (anguis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesaries,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput solis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aries nitidissimus auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:867" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 867</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aether,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:467" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 467</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <trans><tr>with gleaming scales</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus turbavit nitidos exstinctus passer ocellos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31033.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31033.3" n="1" level="3"> Of animals, <hi rend="ital">sleek, plump, fat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31033.4" n="2" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">well-conditioned, well-favored, healthy-looking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me pinguem et nitidum bene curatā cute vises,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>.—So, nitidis sensibus haurire aliquid, <hi rend="ital">with fresh, unblunted, unsated senses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 193</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31033.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Good-looking, handsome, beautiful, neat, elegant, spruce, trim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis nitida femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos pexo capillo nitidos videtis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex nitido fit rusticus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidioris vitae instrumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 16, 30, § 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31033.6" n="4" level="3"> Of fields and plants, <hi rend="ital">blooming, fertile, luxuriant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidae fruges arbustaque laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:594" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi nitidissimi viridissimique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidissima arboris pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 104</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidissimus annus,</quote> <trans><tr>rich, fertile</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:265" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 265</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31033.7" n="5" level="3"> Of the wrestling ring, in allusion to the oil with which the wrestlers' bodies were anointed: palaestrae, <cb n="NITO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:8:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 8, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31033.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">cultivated, polished, refined</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidum quoddam genus verborum et laetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 18, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba nitidiora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isocrates nitidus et comptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 7, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:49" default="NO">49</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitida et curata vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilares nitidique vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:178" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita nitidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 16, 30, § 100</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly, brightly, beautifully, magnificently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nitide nitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenare nitide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nitiobriges: <entryFree id="n31034" type="main" key="Niti^obri_ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nitĭobrīges</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Aquitanian Gaul, between the</hi> Garumna <hi rend="ital">and the</hi> Liger, near the mod. <hi rend="ital">Agen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>; 75; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nitor: <entryFree id="n31035" type="main" key="ni_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nītor</orth>, <itype>nīsus and nixus</itype> (<sense id="n31035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> nitier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1059" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1059</bibl>; old form of the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: gnitus et gnixus a genibus prisci dixerunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=96" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 96</bibl> Müll.), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [from gnitor; root gnic- or gnig-; cf.: nico, conivere], <hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rest upon</hi> something. </sense><sense id="n31035.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31035.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: ambae te obsecramus genibus nixae, <hi rend="ital">we implore thee upon our knees</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">kneeling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpibus suis niti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbescens viriditas, quae nixa fibris stirpium sensim adulescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastili nixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierculā nixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:33:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 33, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis, qui nititur hastā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 760</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paribus nitens Cyllenius alis Constitit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nixus baculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:52" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31035.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nixus in hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 398</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31035.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quā pariens arbore nixa dea est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:21:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 21, 100</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31035.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humi nitens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 380</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: Sisiphu' versat Saxum sudans nitendo, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">niti modo ac statim concidere,</quote> <trans><tr>to strive to rise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31035.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31035.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To make one's way with an effort, to press forward, advance;</hi> and, with respect to the goal, <hi rend="ital">to mount, climb, fly</hi>, etc. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam serpentes ortae extra aquam simul ac primum niti possunt, aquam persequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nituntur gradibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in altas rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aëra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in adversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sursum nitier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1059" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1059</bibl></cit>.—Of violent bodily motion: <cit><quote lang="la">niti corporibus et ea huc illuc, quasi vitabundi aut jacientes tela agitare,</quote> <trans><tr>to struggle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 60, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31035.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To strain in giving birth, to bring forth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 54, § 107</bibl> (al. eniti): <cit><quote lang="la">nitor,</quote> <trans><tr>I am in labor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 302</bibl></cit>; Pseud.-<bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Her. 21, 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31035.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To strain for a stool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31035.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31035.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To strive, to exert one's self, make an effort, labor, endeavor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatio modo virium adsit et tantum, quantum potest, quisque nitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisurus contra regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 38, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro libertate summā ope niti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitebantur, ne gravius in eum consuleretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 13, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unus Miltiades maxime nitebatur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 4, 2</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā vi Cirtam irrumpere nititur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam recuperare niti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio nitor non periisse meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:5:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 5, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 694</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, of soldiers hard pressed in battle: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen virtute et patientia nitebantur atque omnia vulnera sustinebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31035.12" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To strive after</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ad immortalitatem gloriae niti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summa, Quint. prooem. § 20: in vetitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31035.13" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To try to prove, contend</hi> in argument, <hi rend="ital">argue</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitamur igitur nihil posse percipi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31035.14" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To rest, rely, depend upon</hi> a thing. </sense><sense id="n31035.15" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">nixus in nomine inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:909" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 909</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjectura in quā nititur divinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, in quibus causa nititur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus in vitā nitebatur salus civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31035.16" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe niti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio atque auctoritate alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 122</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl>, a, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis hoc uno nititur quod sit ignobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:40:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 40, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31035.17" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ubi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo confugies? ubi nitere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:64:section=155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 64, § 155</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>P. a.</pos>, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nixus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, only <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nixi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">three guardian deities of women in labor, the statues of whom, representing them in a kneeling posture, stood on the Capitol before the chapel of Minerva</hi>, <cb n="NIVE" /> Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">magno Lucinam Nixosque patres clamore vocabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 294</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31036" type="main" key="ni^tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>niteo</etym>, <sense id="n31036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brightness, splendor, lustre, sheen</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31036.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitor exoriens aurorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diurnus,</quote> <trans><tr>the daylight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbarum viridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:783" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 783</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti et auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae,</quote> <trans><tr>of the wood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 40, 79, § 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 64, § 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigerrimus gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 69, § 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitorem cutis facit sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 41, § 84</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitores splendoresque auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31036.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31036.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sleekness, plumpness, good looks, beauty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitor corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urit me Glycerae nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liparei nitor Hebri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus totā nitor in cute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31036.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Neatness, elegance, brilliancy</hi> of external appearance: <cit><quote lang="la">si quem ... aliquid offendit, si purpurae genus, si amicorum catervae, si splendor, si nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:31:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 31, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:180" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum praecipui nitoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 85</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31036.5" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:819" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 819</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludis et externo tincta nitore caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit> (3, 11, 2).—</sense><sense id="n31036.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">splendor, elegance, grace</hi> of style. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibendus erit in eis explicandis quidam orationis nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 32, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domesticus eloquii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitor et cultus descriptionum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 36</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublimitas et magnificentia et nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditione ac nitore praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripsit non sine cultu ac nitore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31036.7" n="B" level="2"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">dignity, excellence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">generis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 17</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">splendid liberality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:149" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nitraria: <entryFree id="n31037" type="main" key="ni^tra_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nitrum</etym>, <sense id="n31037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where natron was dug</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prepared</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 109</bibl> (ib. saep.).</sense></entryFree>
nitratus: <entryFree id="n31038" type="main" key="ni^tra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixed with natron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:55" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:17:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 17, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nitreus: <entryFree id="n31039" type="main" key="ni_^tre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nī^trĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of natron, of soda</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:7:108" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 7, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nitrion: <entryFree id="n31040" type="main" key="nitri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nitrĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n31040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> daphnoides, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 58</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nitrosus: <entryFree id="n31041" type="main" key="ni^tro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nitrum</etym>, <sense id="n31041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of natron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae frigidae genus nitrosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 107</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nitrum: <entryFree id="n31042" type="greek" key="ni^trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭtrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ni/tron</foreign>, also called sal nitrum, <sense id="n31042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">native mineral alkali, native soda, natron;</hi> found chiefly in Media, Egypt, Thrace, and Macedonia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 10, 46, § 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos nitri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and used for washing with: laveris te nitro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31042.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: censuram lomentum aut nitrum esse, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nivalis: <entryFree id="n31043" type="main" key="ni^va_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭvālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nix</etym>, <sense id="n31043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to snow, snowy, snow-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31043.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivalis dies,</quote> <trans><tr>a snowy day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivalia (sc. loca),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 29, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Haemonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 48, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <trans><tr>the region of snow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:225" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hebrus nivali compede vinctus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <trans><tr>water filled with snow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:118:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 118, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua nivalis,</quote> <trans><tr>snow-water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae et pruinosae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31043.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31043.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Cold</hi>: dies, <hi rend="ital">a cold, dull day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicimus nivalem diem, cum altum frigus et triste caelum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:4:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">osculum,</quote> <trans><tr>cold, frigid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:95:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 95, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31043.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Snow-like, snowy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi candore nivali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 538</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivalis Pietas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Symm. 2, 249</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nivarius: <entryFree id="n31044" type="main" key="ni^va_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭvārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to snow</hi>: nivarium colum, <hi rend="ital">a strainer filled with snow, through which generous wines were filtered</hi>, whereas the commoner sorts were merely passed through a linen cloth, <hi rend="ital">filled with snow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:103" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 103</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">the latter called nivarius saccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:104" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 104</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nivatus: <entryFree id="n31045" type="main" key="ni^va_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭvātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cooled with snow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">potiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:13:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nive: <entryFree id="n31046" type="main" key="ni_ve"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīve</orth>, v. ni.</entryFree>
nivens: <entryFree id="n31047" type="main" key="ni_vens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nīvens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <sense id="n31047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">winking</hi> (cf. coniveo): niventibus oculis, v. l. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 115</bibl>, for umentibus.</sense></entryFree>
nivesco: <entryFree id="n31048" type="main" key="ni^vesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭvesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n31048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [nix], <hi rend="ital">to become snow-white</hi>, Anth. Lat. tom. 2, p. 406 Burm.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
niveus: <entryFree id="n31049" type="main" key="ni^ve^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭvĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from snow, snowy, snow-</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) </sense><sense id="n31049.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggeribus niveis informis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 354</bibl></cit>: aqua, <pb n="1211" /> <cb n="NO" /> <hi rend="ital">cooled with snow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:17:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 17, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 104</bibl> and 117: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans><tr>covered with snow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 240</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31049.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">snow-white, snowy</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">a similitudine sic: Corpore niveum candorem, aspectu igneum ardorem assequebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 33, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacerti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc si capite niveae agnae exorari judicas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:36" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Briseis niveo colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 432</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidior nivei folio, Galatea, ligustri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:789" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā notam duxit niveus videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:70" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <trans><tr>clear, pellucid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 504" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:32:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 32, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribuni,</quote> <trans><tr>clothed in white togas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:29" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Quirites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:45" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nivifer: <entryFree id="n31050" type="hapax" key="ni^vi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭvĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nix - fero</etym>, <sense id="n31050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">snow-bearing, covered with snow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">niviferae valles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> G. D. 6, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nivit: <entryFree id="n31051" type="hapax" key="ni^vit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭvit</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n31051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi> [nix], <hi rend="ital">it snows;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf. of a great quantity of missile weapons: sagittis, plumbo et saxis grandinat, nivit, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 507, 27</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 4 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
nivomagus: <entryFree id="n31052" type="main" key="Ni_vo^ma^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nīvŏmăgus</orth>, <sense id="n31052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of the Treveri, otherwise called</hi> Noviomagus, now <hi rend="ital">Neumagen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nivosus: <entryFree id="n31053" type="main" key="ni^vo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nĭvōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nix</etym>, <sense id="n31053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of snow, snowy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems gelida ac nivosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum nivosae grandinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:59:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 59, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Strymon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:22" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scythia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca praegelida ac nivosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pliadum nivosum sidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:95" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 95</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nix: <entryFree id="n31054" type="main" key="nix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nix</orth>, <itype>nĭvis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ni/fa</foreign> (<case>acc.</case>), snow; Lat. ningit, ninguit</etym>, <sense id="n31054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">snow.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31054.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anaxagoras nivem nigram dixit esse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars terrarum obriguit nive pruināque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles nivibus pruinisque obrutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 24, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opposuit natura Alpemque nivemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:152" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duratae solo nives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nives solutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrifera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:306" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 306</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 234</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31054.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">white color, whiteness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis nives,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>white hair</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Prud. praef. Cath. 25 (dura translatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 17</bibl></cit>): eboris, App. de Mundo, p. 69, 21.—</sense><sense id="n31054.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: nives, <hi rend="ital">snows</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a cold climate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nixabundus: <entryFree id="n31055" type="main" key="nixa_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nixābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nixor</etym>, <sense id="n31055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">striving to support one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illā deā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Res Gest. Alex. M. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Res Gest. Alex. M. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nixidi: <entryFree id="n31056" type="main" key="Nixi Di"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nixi Di</orth>, v. 1. nitor <sense id="n31056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nixor: <entryFree id="n31057" type="main" key="nixor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nixor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n31057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep. n.</hi> [1. nitor], <hi rend="ital">to lean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rest upon; to strive, endeavor</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n31057.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:836" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 836</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1001" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 1001</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars vulnere clauda retentat Nixantem (serpentem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 279</bibl></cit> Wagner <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n31057.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to depend upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamenta, quibus nixatur vita salusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 506</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nixurio: <entryFree id="n31058" type="gloss" key="nixu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nixŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n31058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a. desid.</hi> [nixus, from nitor], <hi rend="ital">to wish to lean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rest upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nixurit qui niti vult et in conatu saepius aliquā re perpellitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0590,001:144:20" default="NO"><author>Nigid.</author> 144, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31058.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for parturio, <hi rend="ital">to wish to bring forth</hi>: nixurio, <foreign lang="greek">filotoke/w</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
nixus: <entryFree id="n31059" type="main" key="nixus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nixus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">nīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. nitor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31060" type="main" key="nixus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nixus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. nitor</etym>, <sense id="n31060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pressure</hi> (the same as nisus, v. 2, nisus). </sense><sense id="n31060.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: astra se nixu suo conglobata continent, <hi rend="ital">revolution, course</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 117</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n31060.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a striving, exertion, effort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic ad summum non pervenit nixu (al. nisu), sed impetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:10" default="NO">1, 12, 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n31060.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">pains, throes, travail</hi> of parturition: <cit><quote lang="la">fetūs nixibus edunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboriosi nixūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31060.4" n="III" level="1"> Nixus, <hi rend="ital">a constellation;</hi> v. Engonasi.</sense></entryFree>
no: <entryFree id="n31061" type="main" key="no1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">no</orth>, <itype>nāvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ne/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n31061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to swim, float.</hi> </sense><sense id="n31061.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: alter nare cupit: alter pugnare paratu'st, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=166" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 166</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 258 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">pueris, qui nare discunt, scirpea induitur ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">below,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinus Dicuntur liquidas Neptuni nāsse per undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nat lupus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nantem delphina per undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 19, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piger ad nandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:18:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars nandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:486" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 486</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nat tibi linter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:76" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 76</bibl></cit>;
