<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 374</bibl>.—Prov.: nare sine cortice, <hi rend="ital">to swim without corks</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be able to do without a guardian</hi> (cf. above the passage in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 9</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31061.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., <hi rend="ital">to sail, flow, fly</hi>, etc.: cum <cb n="NOBI" /> juventus Per medium classi barbara navit Athon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(undae) nantes refulgent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nare per aestatem liquidam suspexeris agmen (apium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 59</bibl></cit>.—Of the eyes of drunken persons, <hi rend="ital">to swim</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nant oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 480</bibl></cit>; v. nato.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., swimming, floating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nantes scaphae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:26:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 26, 10</bibl></cit>; as <hi rend="ital">subst., a swimmer;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nantes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">swimming fowls</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">geese, ducks</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">greges nantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31062" type="main" key="No2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">No</orth>, <sense id="n31062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian city</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">Alexandria;</hi> acc. to Bochart, <hi rend="ital">Thebes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Ezech. 30, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noa: <entryFree id="n31063" type="main" key="No_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōa</orth>, <itype>ae, and</itype> (more freq.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōē</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nw=e</foreign>, <sense id="n31063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Noah</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidus (corvus) Noae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Carm. 1, 158</bibl></cit>: arca Noë, Gromat. Vet. 373, 6; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. Carm. 3, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. 4, 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n31063.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fem., daughter of Zelophehad</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Num. 26, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31063.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nobilior: <entryFree id="n31064" type="main" key="No_bi^li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōbĭlĭor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nobilis</etym>, <sense id="n31064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a family name in the</hi> gens Fulvia, e. g. M. Fulvius Nobilior, <hi rend="ital">the vanquisher of the Ætolians and the friend of Ennius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:45" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nobilis: <entryFree id="n31065" type="main" key="no_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (old collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">gnōbĭlis</orth>: nobilem antiqui pro noto ponebant, et quidem per g litteram, ut Plautus in Pseudolo: peregrina facies videtur hominis atque ignobilis, et: oculis meis obviam ignobilis obicitur. Attius in Diomede: ergo me Argos referam, nam hic sum gnobilis. Livius in Virgo: ornamento incedunt gnobili ignobiles, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174</bibl> Müll.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for gnobilis, from gnosco; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gignw/skw</foreign>; v. nosco</etym>, <sense id="n31065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be known</hi> or <hi rend="ital">is known, knowable, known</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31065.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">neque his umquam nobilis fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addidit facinori fidem nobili gaudio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31065.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31065.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wellknown, famous, noted, celebrated, renowned</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clarus, insignis, inclutus, illustris): die festo celebri nobilique, Aphrodisiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus et nobilis rhetor Isocrates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illustre et nobile municipium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:16:section=40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 16, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum clarum et nobile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">63: ex doctrinā nobilis et clarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorum par nobilissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi in philosophiā praeclari et nobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut arcendis sceleribus exemplum nobile esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthus aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 416</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerosque Ledae, Hunc equis, illum superare pugnis Nobilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palma nobilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis e tectis fundere gaesa rotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 42: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam Feceris ipse aliquid propter quod nobilis esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:41" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 41</bibl></cit>: aquae salubritate et medendis corporibus nobiles. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:25:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 25, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulis marinis ad multa nobile fel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 75, § 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastra nobilia ad extrahendum fel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicero vir nobilissimae novitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:34:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 34, 3</bibl></cit>.—In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">notorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocentes qui se scelere fieri nolunt nobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea (amica) est potens, procax, magnifica, sumtuosa, nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille nobilis taurus, quem Phalaris habuisse dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:33:section=73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 33, § 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 9, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31065.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">High-born, of noble birth, noble</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sprung from a family</hi> (either patrician or plebeian) <hi rend="ital">many members of which had filled curule offices, and consequently possessing the</hi> jus imaginum (opp. homo novus or ignobilis; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">generosus, amplus): non facit nobilem atrium plenum fumosis imaginibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 44:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta sit in invidiā apud quosdam nobilis homines novorum hominum virtus et industria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71:section=181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clodia mulier non solum nobilis sed etiam nota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobili genere nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:70:section=180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 70, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines apud nos noti, inter suos nobiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 22, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 58</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōbĭlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a nobleman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiles nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:149:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 149, 8</bibl>: Nobilissimus, <hi rend="ital">most noble</hi>, under the later emperors, <hi rend="ital">a title of the Cæsars and of the members of the imperial family</hi>, Cod. Th. 10, 25, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:11:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 11, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31065.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of a noble kind, noble, excellent, superior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres nobilissimi fundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiliumque greges custos servabat equarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis hic (equus), quocumque venit de gramine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 60</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <cb n="NOCE" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">famously, excellently, splendidly, nobly</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Cæs.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiliter caelare argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 91</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilius philosophari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab exercitu nobilissime tumulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nobilitas: <entryFree id="n31066" type="main" key="no_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nobilis</etym>. <sense id="n31066.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Celebrity, fame, renown</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">eam nobilitatem amittundam video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedicationem nobilitatemque despicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repentina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem nobilitate praecurrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31066.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">High</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noble birth, nobility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad illustrandam nobilitatem suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitate sui municipii facile primus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31066.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the nobility, the nobles, the aristocracy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitatis fautor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis noster nobilitas interiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas rempublicam deseruerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbia commune nobilitatis malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 77</bibl>.—With verb in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">namque coepere nobilitas dignitatem in dominationem vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n31066.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Claudius nobilitatibus externis mitis,</quote> <trans><tr>princes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31066.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Noble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">excellent quality, nobleness, excellence, superiority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum florere Isocratem nobilitate discipulorum videret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:35:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 35, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquio tantum nobilitatis inest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:56" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitate ingenitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima croco Cilicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 6, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 37, 53, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstetricum nobilitas (i. e. nobilissimae obstetrices),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 6, 18, § 67</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilitas sola est atque unica virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:20" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nobiliter: <entryFree id="n31067" type="main" key="no_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nobilis <sense id="n31067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nobilito: <entryFree id="n31068" type="main" key="no_bi^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōbĭlĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>nobilis</etym>. <sense id="n31068.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make known, to render famous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinā militari nobilitatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphic. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphic. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae post mortem nobilitari volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectata ac nobilitata virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 26, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim ex te umquam es nobilitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—Also in an unfavorable sense, <hi rend="ital">to render notorious</hi>: ne eam malefactis nobilitarent, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 352, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultum adulescentulum nobilitas flagitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phalaris, cujus est nobilitata crudelitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterio nobilitatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 5, § 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31068.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To render excellent, to ennoble, improve</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui novitatem suam multis rebus nobilitaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:96:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 96, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster vites nobilitat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae nobilitatos maritos non haberent, ne innobilitatae remanerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 4, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nobiscum: <entryFree id="n31069" type="main" key="no_biscum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōbiscum</orth>, v. ego.</entryFree>
nocens: <entryFree id="n31070" type="main" key="no^cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. noceo <sense id="n31070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nocenter: <entryFree id="n31071" type="main" key="no^center"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏcenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. noceo, <sense id="n31071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
nocentia: <entryFree id="n31072" type="main" key="no^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nocens</etym>, <sense id="n31072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">guilt, transgression</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">deus innocentiae magister, nocentiae judex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noceo: <entryFree id="n31073" type="main" key="no^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi, cĭtum, 2</itype> (<sense id="n31073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> nocerier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 73</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> nocentūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 19</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> noxit: ne boa noxit, Lucil. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. Fama, p. 360 Müll.; Fronto ad M. Caesarem, 3, 13 Mai.), <pos>v. n.</pos> (and <hi rend="ital">a.;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> <foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) [Sanscr. root nac, disappear; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ne/kus</foreign>; cf.: neco, nex, noxa, pernic-ies], <hi rend="ital">to do harm, inflict injury, do hurt to</hi> (cf.: obsum, obficio, laedo).—Constr. </sense><sense id="n31073.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> or with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">declinare ea, quae nocitura videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma alia ad tegendum, alia ad nocendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil nocet,</quote> <trans><tr>it does no harm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocere alteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurejurando accepto, nihil iis nocituros hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura te nociturum non esse homini de hac re nemini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31073.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With a homogeneous or a general (pronominal) object: OB EAM REM NOXAM NOCVERVNT, <hi rend="ital">have been guilty of a crime</hi>, from an old fetial formula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si uredo aut grando quippiam nocuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nocet haec?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:153" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 153</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31073.3" n="(g)" level="5"> In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> (very rare), <hi rend="ital">to be harmed, injured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">larix ab carie aut a tineā non nocetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noceri eas (ciconias) omnibus quidem locis nefas ducunt, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n31073.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi> (class.), <hi rend="ital">an injury is done</hi> or <hi rend="ital">inflicted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne cui noceatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi nihil ab istis noceri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 12, 37</bibl></cit>: ut in agris vastandis <pb n="1212" /> <cb n="NOCT" /> hostibus noceretur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi nihil nocitum iri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque diem decet me morari, neque nocti nocerier,</quote> <trans><tr>that injury be done to the night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 73</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nihil illum nocuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 4, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 10</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., that commits a wicked action, bad, wicked, culpable, criminal</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sons, reus): nocens et nefarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines nocentissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocentissima victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocentissimi mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 32</bibl></cit>: meritā caede nocentūm (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for nocentium; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 35, 45</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 8, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31073.5" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">hurtful, harmful, pernicious, baneful, injurious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pestiferis et nocentibus refugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boletus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:620" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 620</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edit cicutis allium nocentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏcenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hurtfully, injuriously</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nocenter armata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abscessus nocenter adulescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nocivus: <entryFree id="n31074" type="main" key="no^ci_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏcīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>noceo</etym>, <sense id="n31074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hurtful, injurious, noxious</hi> (not ante-Aug., and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 28, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecori nociva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 2, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noctanter: <entryFree id="n31075" type="main" key="noctanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>nox</etym>, <sense id="n31075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by night</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 6, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noctesco: <entryFree id="n31076" type="hapax" key="noctesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n31076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to draw towards night, to grow dark</hi>: omnia noctescunt, Furius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 145, 11</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 3</bibl> (where the word is censured).</sense></entryFree>
nocticola: <entryFree id="n31077" type="main" key="nocti^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>nox-colo</etym>, <sense id="n31077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fond of the night</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lndus,</quote> <trans><tr>who, on account of the excessive heat of the day, is fond of the night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 636</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nocticolor: <entryFree id="n31078" type="main" key="nocti^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctĭcŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nox-color</etym>, <sense id="n31078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nightcolored, black</hi>: nocticolor Memnon (as being an Ethiopian), Laev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 6</bibl>: Styx, Aus. Monos. de Diis, 11.</sense></entryFree>
noctifer: <entryFree id="n31079" type="main" key="nocti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nox-fero, the nightbringer</etym>, <sense id="n31079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the evening-star</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:121" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 121</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noctiluca: <entryFree id="n31080" type="main" key="nocti^lu_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctĭlūca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nox-luceo</etym>, <sense id="n31080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that shines by night;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n31080.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The moon</hi>: Luna quod sola lucet noctu: itaque ea dicta noctiluca in Palatio; <cit><quote lang="la">nam ibi noctu lucet templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=68" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 68</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">canentes Rite crescentem face noctilucam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 38</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n31080.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lantern</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 234, 4</bibl> (Sat. Men. 54, 5).—</sense><sense id="n31080.3" n="III" level="1"> Noctilucam (noctilugam) Lucilius cum dixit obscenum significat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174</bibl> Müll. (Scalig. ad loc. understands, by noctiluca, avis mali ominis noctu lugens; Salmas. Exerc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:page=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> p. 70</bibl>, col. 2, d, reads noctipuga, acc. to a gloss: noctipugam obscenum quod quasi noctibus compungat); v. Müll. ad Fest. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
noctiluga: <entryFree id="n31081" type="gloss" key="nocti^lu_ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctĭlūga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. noctiluca, III.</entryFree>
noctipugam: <entryFree id="n31082" type="gloss" key="nocti^pu_gam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctĭpūgam</orth>, <itype>v noctiluca</itype>, III. <sense id="n31082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
noctisurgium: <entryFree id="n31083" type="hapax" key="nocti^surgi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctĭsurgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>nox-surgo</etym>, <sense id="n31083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a getting up in the night</hi>: nyctegresia, quasi noctisurgium, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. egretus, p. 78 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
noctivagus: <entryFree id="n31084" type="main" key="nocti^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctĭvăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nox-vagus; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 68</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n31084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">night-wandering; that wanders about by night</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">noctivagae faces caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus (sc. Phoebes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:158" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:44" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
noctividus: <entryFree id="n31085" type="hapax" key="nocti^vi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctĭvĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nox-video</etym>, <sense id="n31085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">night-seeing; that sees by night;</hi> of the night-owl, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 571</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noctivigilus: <entryFree id="n31086" type="hapax" key="nocti^vi^gi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctĭvĭgĭlus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, v. noctuvigilus.</entryFree>
noctu: <entryFree id="n31087" type="main" key="noctu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctu</orth>, v. nox.</entryFree>
noctua: <entryFree id="n31088" type="main" key="noctu^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nox</etym>, <sense id="n31088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a night-owl, an owl</hi>, a bird sacred to Minerva: <cit><quote lang="la">noctua, quod noctu canit ac vigilat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 76</bibl></cit> Müll.; Paul. ex Fest. pp. 174 and 175 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctuarum dimicatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 17, 19, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">garrula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seros exercet noctua cantūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 403</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31089" type="main" key="Noctu^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Noctŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: Q. Caedicius Noctua, <hi rend="ital">a consul with</hi> M. Valerius Corvinus A. U. C. 465.</sense></entryFree>
noctuabundus: <entryFree id="n31090" type="hapax" key="noctu^a_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctŭābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>noctu</etym>, <sense id="n31090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having travelled all night</hi> (cf. noctivagus): <cit><quote lang="la">noctuabundus ad me venit cum epistulā tuā tabellarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
noctuinus: <entryFree id="n31091" type="hapax" key="noctu^i_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctŭīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. noctua</etym>, <sense id="n31091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to night-owls</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctuini oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>owls' eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
noctulius: <entryFree id="n31092" type="gloss" key="Noctuli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Noctulĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity of the Brixians</hi>, Inscr. Spon. Miscell. Antiq. p. 115; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 98, 4</bibl>. <cb n="NODU" /></sense></entryFree>
noctulucus: <entryFree id="n31093" type="main" key="noctu_lu_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctūlūcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>nox-luceo</etym>, <sense id="n31093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">watching, waking</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">seeing at night</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:19:section=99" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 19, § 99</bibl> Speng.</sense></entryFree>
nocturnalis: <entryFree id="n31094" type="main" key="nocturna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nocturnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nox</etym>, <sense id="n31094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nocturnal</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cucullus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nocturnus: <entryFree id="n31095" type="main" key="nocturnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nocturnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from the <pos>adv.</pos> noctu, analog. to diurnus from diu</etym>, <sense id="n31095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the night, nocturnal</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">labores diurnos nocturnosque suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:23:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 23, 82</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. diurnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnum praesidium Palatii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturno certare mero, putere diurno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 736</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dark, black faces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 107</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose, of living beings that do any thing <hi rend="ital">at night</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fur nocturnus, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 7, 2, 1: adulter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:144" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus gregibus nocturnus obambulat,</quote> <trans><tr>by night</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 538</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui nocturnus sacra divūm legerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 6, 100</bibl>: advocati jam paene nocturni, <hi rend="ital">summoned almost in the night-time</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">very early</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31095.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nocturnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the god of Night</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noctus: <entryFree id="n31096" type="main" key="noctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, v. nox <sense id="n31096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
noctuvigilus: <entryFree id="n31097" type="main" key="noctu_vi^gi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noctūvĭgĭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">noctīv-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nox-vigilo</etym>, <sense id="n31097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">night-watching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nocuus: <entryFree id="n31098" type="main" key="no^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>noceo</etym>, <sense id="n31098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hurtful, injurious, noxious</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:128" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 128</bibl>; Ser<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Comp. 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nodabilis: <entryFree id="n31099" type="main" key="no_da_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nodo</etym>, <sense id="n31099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knotty</hi> (late Lat.), Vict. Tunon. de Poenit. 3.</sense></entryFree>
nodamen: <entryFree id="n31100" type="hapax" key="no_da_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a knotting, knot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 593</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nodatio: <entryFree id="n31101" type="hapax" key="no_da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n31101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knottiness, nodosity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter nodationis duritiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nodatus: <entryFree id="n31102" type="main" key="no_da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from nodo.</entryFree>
nodia: <entryFree id="n31103" type="main" key="nodi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nodĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">notĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> herba mularis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 115, § 175</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nodinus: <entryFree id="n31104" type="main" key="Nodi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nodīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rivulet near Rome, mentioned in prayers</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 20, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nodo: <entryFree id="n31105" type="main" key="no_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>nodus</etym>, <sense id="n31105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to furnish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fill with knots</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31105.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferula nodata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 42, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornus nodata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 38, 73, § 186</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31105.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tie in a knot, to knot</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 32, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines nodantur in aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum laqueo nodatus ab arto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia phalerari sibi magis quam nodari videntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Cant. Cantic. 1, § 43</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., knotty</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">entangled, intricate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus nodato gurgite vortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:276" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 276</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nodose: <entryFree id="n31106" type="main" key="no_do_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. nodosus <sense id="n31106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
nodositas: <entryFree id="n31107" type="hapax" key="no_do_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nodosus</etym>, <sense id="n31107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">knottiness, nodosity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tortuosissima et implicatissima nodositas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nodosus: <entryFree id="n31108" type="main" key="no_do_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nodus</etym>, <sense id="n31108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of knots, knotty</hi> (syn. geniculatus). </sense><sense id="n31108.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:298" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lina,</quote> <trans><tr>nets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 153</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">plagae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:110" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:247" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <trans><tr>the bones of the neck, the cervical vertebræ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cheragra (so called from its producing blains and knots on the fingers),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">podagra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n31108.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">knotty, intricate, difficult</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodosissimi libri enodati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 4:16" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cicuta,</quote> <trans><tr>familiar with the intricacies of the law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 69</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nodosam exsolvite stipem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit> (dub.).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">intricately, obscurely</hi> (post-class.); <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodosius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nodotus: <entryFree id="n31109" type="main" key="No_do_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōdōtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Nōdūt-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n31109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity who presided over corn, and brought it as far as the knots in the stalk</hi>: praefecerunt ergo ... geniculis nodisque culmorum deum Nodutum, Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 8; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nodulus: <entryFree id="n31110" type="main" key="no_du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>nodus</etym>, <sense id="n31110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little knot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 5, 13, § 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 139, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nodus: <entryFree id="n31111" type="main" key="no_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for gnodus; Sanscr. root gadh-, gandh-, grasp; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*xanda/nw</foreign>, hold; <foreign lang="greek">gna/qos</foreign>, jaw; Lat. pre-hend-o; Germ. Knoten; Engl. knot</etym>, <sense id="n31111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a knot</hi> (cf. nexus). </sense><sense id="n31111.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodus vinculumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 4</bibl></cit>: necte tribus nodis ternos, Amarylli, colores,<cb n="NOLA" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cacum Corripit in nodum complexus,</quote> <trans><tr>clasping him as in a knot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodos manu diducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 560</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodus Herculis or Herculaneus,</quote> <trans><tr>a knot difficult to untie, of which Hercules was held to be the inventor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus tibi nodus, sed Herculaneus, restat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:38" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam nodus Gordius difficillimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: cingulum (novae nuptae) Herculaneo nodo vinctum vir solvit ominis gratia, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. cingulo, p. 63 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n31111.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31111.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A girdle</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nodoque sinus collecta fluentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 320</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:13:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 13, 5</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, astronom.: nodus anni,</quote> <trans><tr>the circle of the equator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 688</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31111.4" n="2" level="3"> A mode of dressing the hair, <hi rend="ital">a knot, club</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rheni nodos,</quote> <trans><tr>the hair of the Germans gathered into a club</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 37, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">insigne gentis obliquare crinem nodoque substringere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31111.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodi,</quote> <trans><tr>a knotted fishing-net</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 664</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31111.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A knot, knob, node</hi> on a joint of an animal's body: <cit><quote lang="la">crura sine nodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix articulorum nodis jungitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 67, § 177</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:217" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 88, § 217</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dirae nodus hyaenae,</quote> <trans><tr>a backbone, dorsal vertebra</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 672</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Hence, nodi articulorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a swelling, tumor on the joints</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 5, 13, § 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:110" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 12, 36, § 110</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31111.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A knot, knob, fold</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n31111.8" n="(a)" level="5"> In wood or the branches of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">baculum sine nodo aduncum tenens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipes gravidus nodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 507</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum solidum nodis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gracilitas harundinis, distincta nodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 3</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">the knotty club of Hercules</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1661" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1661</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31111.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Of a writhing serpent: <cit><quote lang="la">nixantem nodis seque in sua membra plicantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 279</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31111.10" n="(g)" level="5"> Prov.: nodum in scirpo quaerere, <hi rend="ital">to look for knots in a bulrush</hi> (which contains none), i. e. <hi rend="ital">to find difficulties where there are none</hi>, Enn. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=330" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 330</bibl> Müll. (Sat. v. 46 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">in scirpo nodum quaeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31111.11" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A knot, hard part</hi> of a thing; <cit><quote lang="la">so of metals,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 37, § 136</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of precious stones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31111.12" n="7" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A star in the constellation</hi> Pisces, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> Germ. Arat. 243</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n31111.13" n="8" level="3"> In astron.: <cit><quote lang="la">nodi,</quote> <trans><tr>the four points in the heavens where the seasons begin, the nodes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 618</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 430</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n31111.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n31111.15" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a band, bond</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his igitur singulis versibus quasi nodi apparent continuationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:66:222" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 66, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut laxioribus nodis resolvemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:127" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amabilissimum nodum amicitiae tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31111.16" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n31111.17" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bond, obligation</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">exsolvere animum nodis religionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponere nodos, i. e. jusjurandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 39</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n31111.18" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A knotty point, difficulty, impediment</hi>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum hic nodus expediatur non putet senatus nos oportere decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: incideramus in difficilem nodum, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Abantem interimit, pugnae nodumque moramque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum scopulus et nodus et mora publicae securitatis superesset Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui juris nodos et legum aenigmata solvat (an allusion to the Gordian knot),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 50</bibl></cit> (hence, Cicuta nodosus; v. nodosus).— Esp.: nodus linguae, <hi rend="ital">the bond</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tie of the tongue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodum linguae rumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodos linguae solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:7:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
nodutus: <entryFree id="n31112" type="main" key="No_du_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōdūtus</orth>, v. Nodotus.</entryFree>
noe: <entryFree id="n31113" type="main" key="No_e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōē</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*nw=e</foreign> (Hebr. <foreign />), <sense id="n31113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Noah</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Carm. 1, 174</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:24:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 24, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 6, 13</bibl>; v. Noa.</sense></entryFree>
noegeum: <entryFree id="n31114" type="main" key="noege_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nœgēum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n31114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garment trimmed with purple;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">a white upper garment</hi>: noegeum quidam amiculi genus praetextum purpura; quidam candidum ac perlucidum, quasi a navo (nauco), quod putamen quorundam pomorum est tenuissimum non sine candore, ut Livius ait in Odyssia: simul ac lacrimas de ore noegeo detersit, id. est candido, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=174" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 174</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">noegeum nigrum pallium tenue,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Placid.</author> p. 486</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
noenum: <entryFree id="n31115" type="main" key="noenum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">noenum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">noenu</orth>, v. non <sense id="n31115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
noerus: <entryFree id="n31116" type="greek" key="no^e^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">noero/s</foreign>, <sense id="n31116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gifted with understanding</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nola: <entryFree id="n31117" type="hapax" key="No_la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nolo</etym>, <sense id="n31117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Unwilling</hi>, an appellation sarcastically given to the dissolute Clodia: in triclinio Coam, in cubiculo Nolam, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 53</bibl>. <pb n="1213" /> <cb n="NOMA" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31118" type="main" key="no^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jusserat (canem) in rabido gutture ferre nolam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Fab. 7, 8</bibl></cit> dub. (al. notam).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n31119" type="main" key="No_la3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of remote antiquity in Campania, founded by the Ausonians, afterwards conquered by the Tuscans, and colonized by the Chalcidians, still called Nola</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:7:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 7, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:161" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 161</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n31119.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (Nŏlānus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11, 308), <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Nola, Nolan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:293" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 293</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Nolans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 25</bibl> and 26.—</sense><sense id="n31119.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Nōlensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Nola</hi>: episcopus, Aug. Civ. Dei, 1, 10.</sense></entryFree>
nolens: <entryFree id="n31120" type="main" key="no_lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from nolo.</entryFree>
nolenter: <entryFree id="n31121" type="spur" key="no_lenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōlenter</orth>, a false read. for nocenter, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 14</bibl>.</entryFree>
nolentia: <entryFree id="n31122" type="main" key="no_lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nolo</etym>, <sense id="n31122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwillingness</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noliba: <entryFree id="n31123" type="main" key="Noli^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nolĭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n31123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Tarraconian Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
nolo: <entryFree id="n31124" type="main" key="no_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōlo, nōlŭi</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">nolle</orth> (nevis for non vis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 32</bibl> Brix ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:119 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 119 al.</bibl>: <sense id="n31124.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">nevolt for non vult,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 29</bibl>; Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 144, 7</bibl>; v. Don. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 2</bibl>: noltis for non vultis, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 381</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">gerund. abl.</hi> nolendo, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 27</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. irreg.</hi> [ne-volo], <hi rend="ital">to wish</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">will ... not; not to wish, to be unwilling</hi>. </sense><sense id="n31124.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: SI NOLET, ARCERAM NE STERNITO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi ingenium mulierum: nolunt, ubi velis: ubi nolis, cupiunt ultro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi nolint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 31, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo, eundem populum imperatorem et portitorem esse terrarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluribus praesentibus eas res jactari nolebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nollet carmine quemquam Describi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procedere recte Qui moechos non voltis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. in <hi rend="ital">imp.</hi>, noli, nolito, nolite, etc., with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> periphrastically for the <hi rend="ital">imp., do not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli irascier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli avorsari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:33:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 33, 125</bibl></cit>: nolito putare, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 505, 20</bibl>: nolite, hospites, ad me adire, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl> (Trag. v. 404 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nolite, judices, existimare, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 42, 105</bibl></cit>: nolitote mirari, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 481, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli vexare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:126" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 126</bibl></cit>.— Sometimes with <hi rend="ital">velle</hi> pleonastically: <cit><quote lang="la">nolite, judices ... hunc jam naturā ipsā occidentem velle maturius exstingui vulnere vestro, quam suo fato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 4, 2</bibl>.—Sometimes followed by a negative, which does not destroy the negation: <cit><quote lang="la">nolui deesse, ne tacitae quidem flagitioni tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45</bibl>: nollem, <hi rend="ital">I would not, I could wish not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nollem factum,</quote> <trans><tr>I am sorry for it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthaginem et Numantiam funditus sustulerunt: nollem Corinthum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 11, 35</bibl></cit>: quod nolim, <hi rend="ital">which Heaven forbid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">videbis, si erit, quod nolim, arcessendus, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 100</bibl>: non nolle, <hi rend="ital">to have no objection, to be willing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se non nolle dixisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:18:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 18, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos ego nominarem: neque ipsi nolunt,</quote> <trans><tr>and they have no objection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 26, 72</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me nolente,</quote> <trans><tr>without my consent, against my will</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolente senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolentibus umbris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 175</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n31124.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to wish ill, be adverse</hi> to a person (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cui qui nolunt, iidem tibi, quod eum ornāsti, non sunt amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">nōlens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">unwilling</hi> (post-Aug. for invitus): <cit><quote lang="la">dignitati ejus aliquid adstruere inopinantis, nescientis, immo etiam fortasse nolentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
noluntas: <entryFree id="n31125" type="gloss" key="no_luntas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nōluntas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>nolo</etym>, <sense id="n31125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unwillingness</hi>: noluntas ab eo quod nolumus, sicut voluntas ab eo, quod volumus, Placid. Gloss. ap. Mai. Auct. class. 6, p. 568, a.</sense></entryFree>
nomades: <entryFree id="n31126" type="main" key="No^ma^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏmădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. Nomas.</entryFree>
nomae: <entryFree id="n31127" type="main" key="no^mae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">nŏmae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. nome.</entryFree>
nomaeus: <entryFree id="n31128" type="main" key="No^maeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Nŏmaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n31128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Nomæ, in Sicily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:266" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 266</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
